src: Pastikeun leungeun anjeun sakumaha tiasa santai bari tetep pencét kabéh nada anu leres - ogé cobi ulah ngadamel seueur gerakan asing sareng ramo anjeun. Ku cara ieu, anjeun bakal capék padahal ngan maén sakedik. Émut, henteu kudu mencet konci sakuat tanaga pikeun nambah suara sapertos dina piano. Dinu akordion, pikeun ngengingkeun volume langkung, anggo bagian handap langkung teuas atanapi langkung enggal.
mt: Keep your elbows relaxed while you press all the keys - and don't make too many extraneous and unnecessary movements. This way, you will play softly, but not too softly. Do not press the keys too hard to increase the volume as on a piano. To increase the volume on an accordion, press the lower keys more slowly or more quickly.
ref: Make sure your hand is as relaxed as possible while still hitting all the notes correctly - also try not to make much extraneous motion with your fingers. This way, you will tire yourself out as little as possible. Remember there's no need to hit the keys with a lot of force for extra volume like on the piano. On the accordion, to get extra volume, you use the bellows with more pressure or speed.

src: Hiji masalah anu paling umum nalika nyobaan ngarubah pilem kana format DVD nyaéta pemindaian leleuwiheun. Seseueurna tipi didamel pikeun dipikaresep ku masarakat umum. Kusabab alasan éta, sadaya nu anjeun tingal di tipi tos dipotong watesna, luhur, handap, sareng sisina. Iyeu dijieun jang mastikeun yen gambar nutupan sakabeh layar. Iyeu disebut overscan. Hanjakalna, nalika anjeun midamel DVD, tepina sigana bakal dipotong ogé, jeung upami videona gaduh terjamahan anu caket pisan ka handapeunna, tarjamahna moal ditampilkeun pinuh.
mt: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a film to DVD format is overscan. This is done to appeal to the general public. Because of this, everything that is on the tipi is cut off, top, bottom, and sides. This is done to make sure that the picture fills the entire screen. This is called overscan. However, when you make a DVD, it will be cut off as well, and if your video has subtitles that are close to the bottom, they will not be shown completely.
ref: One of the most common problems when trying to convert a movie to DVD format is the overscan. Most televisions are made in a way to please the general public. For that reason, everything you see on the TV had the borders cut, top, bottom and sides. This is made to ensure that the image covers the whole screen. That is called overscan. Unfortunately, when you make a DVD, it's borders will most likely be cut too, and if the video had subtitles too close to the bottom, they won't be fully shown.

src: Rencana na Amerika ngandalkeun serangan anu diatur ti tilu arah nu béda. Jendral John Cadwalder bakal ngaluncurkeun serangan selingan keur garnisun na Inggris di Bordentown, keur ngahadang kabeh bantosan. Jendral James Ewing bakal mawa 700 milisi meuntas walungan dina Trenton Ferry, ngarebut jembatan di luhur Walungan Assunpink jeung nyegah kabeh pasukan musuh kabur. Pasukan penyerangan kahiji anu terdiri ti 2.400 lalaki arék meuntas wahangan, salapan mil di kalér Treton, terus dibagi jadi dua kelompok, hiji di handap Greene jeung hiji dihandap Sullivan, jang ngalakukeun serangan saméméh janari.
mt: The Americans plan to attack from three different directions. General John Cadwalder will launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, to block all reinforcements. General James Ewing will lead 700 militiamen across the river at Trenton Ferry, capture the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent the enemy from retreating. The first attacking force of 2,400 men will cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, to launch the attack before dawn.
ref: The American plan relied on launching coordinated attacks from three different directions. General John Cadwalder would launch a diversionary attack against the British garrison at Bordentown, in order to block off any reinforcements. General James Ewing would take 700 militia across the river at Trenton Ferry, seize the bridge over the Assunpink Creek and prevent any enemy troops from escaping. The main assault force of 2,400 men would cross the river nine miles north of Trenton, and then split into two groups, one under Greene and one under Sullivan, in order to launch a pre-dawn attack.

src: "Saatos diadopsi ku Kongrés dina kaping 4 Juli, rarancang tulisan leungeun anu ditandatanganan ku Présidén Kongrés John Hancock sareng Sekretaris Charles Thomson teras dikirim sababaraha blok ka toko percetakan John Dunlap. Di wengi éta, 150 dugi ka 200 lembar didamel , anu ayeuna kasohor janten ""Selebaran Dunlop"". Pembacaan dokumén di publik mimitina dilakukeun ku John Nixon dina Gedong Kemerdekaan Amérika kaping 8 Juli. 1 urang dikirim ka George Washington kaping 6 Juli anu dibaca ka pasukanana di New York kaping 9 Juli. Salinan nepi ka London di 10 Agustus. 25 Dunlap anu kawéntar masih kénéh jadi salinan dokumen pangkolotna anu tetep aya. Salinan tulisan leungeun aslina teu kasalametkeun."
mt: "After being adopted by Congress on July 4, the handwritten text signed by President of Congress John Hancock and Secretary Charles Thomson was sent a few blocks to the printing shop of John Dunlap. That night, 150 to 200 copies were made, now known as the "Dunlap broadsides". The document was first publicly read by John Nixon in the Declaration of Independence on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6 and read to his troops in New York on July 9. Copies reached London on August 10. 25 Dunlap copies still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document still in existence. The original handwritten text has not been damaged."
ref: "After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap. Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as ""Dunlap broadsides"". The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8. One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10. The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived."

src: Penjajah, ningali kagiatan iyeu, geus manggil bantosan oge. Pasukan anu nguatkeun posisi maju kaasup resimen New Hampshire ka-1 sarta ka-3 ti 200 jalmi, dihandap Kolonel John Stark sarta James Reed (duanana teras naek pangkat jenderal). Pasukan Stark geus nyandak posisi dina sapanjang pager di ujung kalér posisi Penjajah. Pas cai surut muka celah sapanjang Walungan Mystic nepi ka wetaneun semenanjung, aranjeunna geura-geura ngalegaan dinding pagér ku batu-batu leutik  nepi  ka bagian kalér anu tuntungna ujung cai di pantai leutik. Gridley atawa Stark masang tihang anu jangkungna kurang leuwih 100 suku (30 m) di hareupeun pager jeung marentahkeun supaya euweuh nu nembak nepi kabeh semah lewat.
mt: The invaders, seeing this activity, also called for reinforcements. The force that advanced to the position included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both of whom later became generals). Stark's force had taken a position along the northern edge of the position of the Invaders. As they retreated before the Invaders, they gradually built up a wall of small stones along the length of the Mystic River to the western end of the peninsula, where they were stopped by the sea. Gridley or Stark erected a tall stockade in front of the wall and ordered that no one fire until every stone was over it.
ref: The Colonists, seeing this activity, had also called for reinforcements. Troops reinforcing the forward positions included the 1st and 3rd New Hampshire regiments of 200 men, under Colonels John Stark and James Reed (both later became generals). Stark's men took positions along the fence on the north end of the Colonist's position. When low tide opened a gap along the Mystic River along the northeast of the peninsula, they quickly extended the fence with a short stone wall to the north ending at the water's edge on a small beach. Gridley or Stark placed a stake about 100 feet (30 m) in front of the fence and ordered that no one fire until the regulars passed it.

src: Tiongkok kuno gaduh cara unik keur ngabédakeun periode jaman, unggal tahapan Tiongkok atawa unggal kaluwarga nu gaduh kuasa nyaéta dinasti anu bénten. Tiap unggal dinasti ogé jaman henteu stabil nu dibagi ku sababaraha propinsi. Anu pangkasohor na di periode ieu nyaéta Jaman Tilu Karajaan anu lumangsung salamin 60 taun antara Dinasti Han sareng Dinasti Jin. Salami periode ieu perang sengit kajadian antara seeur bangsawan pikeun ngarebut tahta. Tilu Karajaan mangrupikeun salah sahiji éra anu paling numpahkeun getih dina sajarah Cina Kuno, rébuan jalma maot pikeun diuk di korsi paling luhur di istana ageung di Xi'an.
mt: China had a unique way of dividing its periods of time, each era or dynasty was different. Each era was also not stable and divided into several provinces. The most famous of these periods was the Three Kingdoms era which lasted 60 years between the Han and Jin dynasties. During this period, a fierce war took place between the nobles to seize the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in the history of ancient China, thousands of people died to sit on the highest throne in the grand palace in Xi'an.
ref: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty. Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty. During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne. The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.

src: koloni tentara sireum babareungan sareng nyieun sarang dina béda-béda waktos. Dina fase nomad, sireum tentara ngabaris sapat sapeuting teras eureun jang berkemah pabeubeurang. Koloni mimitian tahap hirup nomaden pas persediaan dahareun ngurangan. Dina tahap ieu, koloni ngadamel sarang sementara nu digentos unggal dinten. Tiap-tiap pawai atanapi penjarahan ieu lumangsung kira-kira 17 dinten lamina.
mt: Army ant colonies are characterized by a series of movements and nest building. In the nomadic phase, army ants march for a few hours and then stop to rest. The colony begins the nomadic phase when food supplies are reduced. At this stage, the colony makes a temporary nest which is abandoned each day. Each raid or foraging expedition lasts about 17 days.
ref: Army ant colonies march and nest in different phases as well. In the nomadic phase, army ants march at night and stop to camp during the day. The colony begins a nomadic phase when available food has decreased. During this phase, the colony makes temporary nests that are changed everyday. Each of these nomadic rampages or marches lasts for approximately 17 days.

src: Seueur anu ngalakukeun panalungtikan irama dina fisiologi sareng tingkah laku sering pisan ngagumantung kana ayana siklus endogen sareng produksina ngaliwatan jam biologis. Ritme périodik, anu teu hungkul ngaréspon kana tawis periodik ti jabi, atos dicatet kanggo kalobaan mahluk hirup, kaasup baktéri, suweng, pepelakan, sareng sato. Jam biologis nyaeta osilator mandiri anu arek neruskeun periode siklus bebas bahkan upami heunteu aya tanda-tanda eksternal.
mt: Many who conduct research into biological rhythms often depend on the presence of endogenous rhythms and their production through the biological clock. Periodic rhythms, not only responding to periodic changes in light, are recorded for many living things, including bacteria, plants, and animals. The biological clock is an autonomous oscillator that continues to maintain a free-running period even if there are no external cues.
ref: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks. Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals. Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.

src: Populasi mangrupikeun kumpulan organisme tertentu tina macem-macem spésiés di daérah géograpis tertentu. Lamun kabéh jelema dina hiji populasi sarua dumasarkeun kana phenotypic nu tangtu éta téh katelahna monomorphic. Nalika sato nunjukkeun sababaraha kalakuan tertentu disebut polimorfik.
mt: A population is a group of organisms of the same species living in the same area. If all people in a population are the same in terms of a particular phenotype, that is called monomorphic. When an organism shows several different behaviors, it is called polymorphic.
ref: A population is the collection of organisms of a particular species within a given geographic area. When all individuals in a population are identical with regard to a particular phenotypic trait they are known as monomorphic. When the individuals show several variants of a particular trait they are polymorphic.

src: Pariwisata berbasis alam narik minat masarakat pikeun nganjang ka daérah alam kalayan tujuanna pikeun menikmati pemandangan alam, kalebet pepelakan liar sareng sato. Conto kagiatan di tempat éta nyaeta moro, mancing, popotoan, nonton manuk, sareng ngunjungan taman teras diajar ngeunaan ékosistem. Misalna ngunjungan, nyandak gambar, sareng diajar ngeunaan orang utan di Kalimantan.
mt: Nature-based tourism attracts people to visit natural areas with the goal of enjoying the scenery, wildlife, and vegetation. Examples of activities in these areas include trekking, fishing, photography, bird watching, and learning about orangutans in Borneo.
ref: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife. Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem. An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.

src: Unggal isuk, jalma-jalma ninggalkeun kota alit ku mobil pikeun nuju ka tempat kerjana  teras papasan jalma sanés anu tujuanana damel di tempat anu manehna kakara tinggalkeun. Dina angkutan anu dinamis ieu téh kabéh jelema kumaha waé bisa terhubung, sareng ngadukung, sistem angkutan anu didasari ku mobil pribadi. Élmu ayeuna nunjukkeun yén ékonomi karbon masif ieu parantos nyingkireun biosper ti 1 nagara anu stabil anu ngadukung évolusi manusa dina 2 juta taun ka pengker.
mt: Every day, people leave small towns by car to go to their jobs and then encounter other people who are going to the same place they are leaving. In this dynamic transportation system, everyone is somehow connected, and supporting, a system of transportation based on private cars. Current science shows that this massive carbon economy is stripping the biosphere from one stable country that has supported human evolution for 2 million years to the brink of collapse.
ref: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left. In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars. Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.

src: Atom tiasa dianggap minangka hiji blok wangunan dasar ti sadaya matéri. Ieu téh éntitas anu rumit pisan anu menurut model Bohr nu disederhanakeun mah, nyaeta terdiri tina inti pusat anu ngorbit ku elektron, siga nu sarua jeung planet anu ngorbit ka matahari - tingali gambar 1.1 Nukleus téh diwangun ku dua partikel - neutron jeung proton. Proton boga muatan listrik positip sementawis neutron teu boga aliran listrik. Élektron boga aliran listrik négatip.
mt: An atom can be considered as a basic building block of all matter. This is a complex entity, according to the simplified Bohr model, consisting of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, like planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1 The nucleus is composed of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge, while neutrons have no electric charge. Electrons have a negative electric charge.
ref: The atom can be considered to be one of the fundamental building blocks of all matter. Its a very complex entity which consists, according to a simplified Bohr model, of a central nucleus orbited by electrons, somewhat similar to planets orbiting the sun - see Figure 1.1. The nucleus consists of two particles - neutrons and protons. Protons have a positive electric charge while neutrons have no charge. The electrons have a negative electric charge.

src: Sacara virtual sadaya komputer anu dipaké ayeuna didasarkeun dina manipulasi inpormasi anu disandikeun dina wangun angka binér. Angka binér ngan gaduh 1 tina 2 peunteun, nyaéta 0 atawa 1, sareng éta disebat digit binér - atawa bit, keur nganggo jargon komputer.
mt: In virtual reality, all computers currently used are based on manipulating information represented in binary form. Binary numbers have only one of two points, 0 or 1, and this is called a binary digit - or bit, for computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: Sacara virtual sadaya komputer anu dipaké ayeuna didasarkeun dina manipulasi inpormasi anu disandikeun dina wangun angka binér. Angka binér ngan gaduh 1 tina 2 peunteun, nyaéta 0 atawa 1, sareng éta disebat digit binér - atawa bit, keur nganggo jargon komputer.
mt: In virtual reality, all computers currently used are based on manipulating information represented in binary form. Binary numbers have only one of two points, 0 or 1, and this is called a binary digit - or bit, for computer jargon.
ref: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers. A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.

src: "Blog ogé tiasa ngabantosan ningkatkeun kamampuan nyeratna murid. Sedengkeun siswa sering ngamimitian pangalaman bloggingna ku tata basa leueur sareng éjahan, ayana pamirsa umumna ngarobih éta. Margi siswa nyaéta peserta nu mawi kritis, nu nulis blog mimiti bajoang ngembangkeun pangbisa nyeratna kanggo nyingkirkeun kritik. Ogé blogging ""mekarkeun mahasiswa janten langkung paham ngeunaan dunya di sakurilingna."" Pangabutuh pikeun ngawartosan minat pamiarsa janten inspirasi murid janten pinter sareng langkung menarik (Toto, 2004). Ngadamel blog nyaéta alat nu ngainspirasi kerja sama, sareng ngadorong murid pikeun nambah élmu anu diluar pelajaran sakola biasa. kagunaan blog anu alus teh nyaeta ""bisa ngagerakeun murid pikeun leuwih bisa nganalisa tur kritis; kusabab aktif narima materi ti internet, murid jadi bisa ngartikeun atau nangtukeun posisi maranehna dina harti jalma sejen' teu hilap nulis pamadegan maranehna dina masalah-masalah sejen (Oravec, 2002)."
mt: "Blogs can also help to improve students' writing skills. While students often begin their blogging experience with poor grammar and spelling, the presence of a general audience often drives them to improve their writing for criticism. By blogging, students become more aware of the world around them." The need for accountability to an audience drives students to improve their writing and become more interesting (Toto, 2004). Creating a blog is an instrument that promotes collaboration, and drives students to expand their knowledge beyond the traditional school curriculum. The positive use of blogs is that it can ""encourage students to be more analytical and critical; because they are actively receiving information from the Internet, students can articulate or define their position in the world of others' (Oravec, 2002)."
ref: "Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that. Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism. Also blogging ""forces students to become more savvy about the world around them."" The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004). Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day. Appropriate use of blogs ""can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002)."

src: Komunikasi heunteu asup mere waktu jang refleksi jeung bereaksi ka batur. Ieu midamel siswa tiasa ngadalikeun gawéan kalawan kagancangan maranéhanana sorangan sareng ngadalikeun kagancangan inpormasi instruksional. Iwal ti éta, aya batas waktos anu langkung saalit kalayanan kamungkinan waktos gawé anu fleksibel. Pamakéan Internét sareng Situs ngamungkinkeun para pangguna ngagaduhan aksés kana inpormasi sapanjang waktu. Murid ogé tiasa naroskeun ka guru iraha waé waktosna sareng ngarepkeun tanggepan anu lumayan gancang, tinimbang nungguan dugi ka rapat pasamoan.
mt: Communication is not always immediate and responsive to feedback. This allows students to work at their own pace and respond to instructional information at their own pace. In addition, there are time limits that may be more flexible than traditional classroom time. Internet and site access allow users to access information at any time. Students can also ask questions to teachers where and when they are needed, rather than waiting until a meeting.
ref: Asynchronous communication encourages time for reflection and reaction to others. It allows students the ability to work at their own pace and control the pace of instructional information. In addition, there are fewer time restrictions with the possibility of flexible working hours. (Bremer, 1998) The use of the Internet and the World Wide Web allows learners to have access to information at all times. Students can also submit questions to instructors at any time of day and expect reasonably quick responses, rather than waiting until the next face-to-face meeting.

src: Kastil abad pertengahan tradisional parantos lila ngainspirasi imajinasi, midamel urang ngabayangkeun olahraga kuda anggo tombak, jamuan pituangeun jeung sopan santun Arthurian. Sanajan nangtung di sakuriling bangunan ruksak anu geus rébuan taun, geuwat ngingetkeun sora sareng ka ambu aroma pertempuran anu parantos lami. Sareng tiasa ngadangukeun sora suku kuda di jalan anu taringgul jeung tiasa ngaungkeun kasieun anu timbul tina liang jero taneuh. Tapi emang na imajinasi urang dumasar kana kanyataan? Naha istana diwangun mimitina? Kumaha cara wangunan dirarancang jeung diwangun?
mt: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, with us envisioning jousting tournaments, feasts and Arthurian courtliness. Though standing in the midst of crumbling buildings that are thousands of years old, it conjures up the sound and smell of long-ago battles. And one can hear the sound of hooves on the road and see the rising smoke from underground caves. But is our imagination based on reality? Were the castles built first? How were the buildings designed and built?
ref: The traditional medieval castle has long inspired the imagination, conjuring up images of jousts, banquets and Arthurian chivalry. Even standing amidst thousand year-old ruins it is easy to bring to mind the sounds and smells of battles long gone, to almost hear the clatter of hooves on the cobbles and to smell the fear rising from the dungeon pits. But is our imagination based on reality? Why were castles built in the first place? How were they designed and built?

src: Khusus pikeun periode ieu, Kastil Kirby Muxloe langkung mangrupikeun bumi anu dikubeng ku bénténg tina bénténg anu leres. Jandela kaca anu ageung jeung témbok ipis moal tahan lila kana panarajang paos nu tos ditentukeun pikeun waktu nu lami. Dina taun 1480-an, nalika konstruksi dimimiti ku Tuan Hastings, nagara ieu rukun répéh sareng pertahanan ngan diperyogikeun ngalawan gorombolan leutik begal anu sok kukuriling.
mt: For this period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more like a land surrounded by a castle of a castle. The large windows and flimsy walls could not withstand the pounding of the cannons that were previously used against small bands of raiders.
ref: Typical for the period, Kirby Muxloe Castle is more of a fortified house than a true castle. Its large glazed windows and thin walls would not have been able to resist a determined attack for long. In the 1480s, when its construction was begun by Lord Hastings, the country was relatively peaceful and defense was only required against small bands of roving marauders.

src: Kusabab parobahan jarak lumpat ti saparapat ka satengh mil, gancang janten teu pati penting sareng daya tahan anu janten kabutuhan mutlak. Tangtu wae atlit lumpat satengah mil kelas kakap, jalmi nu tiasa ngéléhkeun waktu dua menit, kudu boga laju nu cekap, tapi katahananna kudu dilatih dina sagala kaayaan. Sawareh lumpat lintas alam dina musim dingin, digabungkeun jeung latihan olahraga keur awak bagian luhur, eta nu pang alusna keur persiapan musim lumpat.
mt: Because of the change in distance from 400 to 500 meters, speed is not so important and endurance is a necessary requirement.  Indeed, a 500 meter class sprinter who can beat two minutes, must have a good speed, but his endurance must be trained in all conditions.  Many cross-country skiers in the winter, combined with training for the upper body, is the most effective preparation for the ski season.
ref: With the change from the quarter to the half mile run, speed becomes of much less importance and endurance becomes an absolute necessity. Of course a first-class half-miler, a man who can beat two minutes, must be possessed of a fair amount of speed, but endurance must be cultivated at all hazards. Some cross country running during the winter, combined with gymnasium work for the upper part of the body, is the best preparation for the running season.

src: Keur ngahasilkeun kamampuan nu elit teu tiasa ngan ti kabiasaan nutrisi nu leres hungkul, tapi eta tiasa ngaruh pisan pikeun kasehatan atlit ngora sacara umum. Ngajaga kasaimbangan énergi nu séhat, ngalaksanakeun kabiasaan hidrasi nu mujarab, jeung ngarti kana macem-macem aspék kabiasaan suplemén tiasa ngabantu atlit keur ningkatkeun kamampuan aranjeuna jeung ningkatkeun kanikmatan dina olahraga na.
mt: To achieve elite performance, it is not only about having a healthy diet, but this can also affect an athlete's overall health. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, implementing effective hydration practices, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation can help athletes improve their performance and enjoy their sport more.
ref: Proper nutritional practices alone cannot generate elite performances, but they can significantly affect young athletes' overall wellness. Maintaining a healthy energy balance, practicing effective hydration habits, and understanding the various aspects of supplementation practices can help athletes improve their performance and increase their enjoyment of the sport.

src: Lumpat jarak menengah kaasup olahraga nu teu mahal; kumaha oge, loba salah paham kana sababaraha alat nu dibutuhkeun keur miluan. Produk oge tiasa dimeser mun aya kabutuhan, ngan biasana ngan aya epek leuitk pisan atawa malah teu aya epekna. atlet biheung ngarasa anjeunna leuwih milih hiji produk sanajan teu masihan manfaat nanaon
mt: Medium-distance running includes many inexpensive sports; how also, many misunderstandings about some of the equipment needed to participate. Products also can be customized if there is a need, but usually there is little or no customization. athletes feel that they prefer a product even though it does not have much benefit
ref: Middle distance running is a relatively inexpensive sport; however, there are many misconceptions regarding the few pieces of equipment required to participate. Products can be purchased as needed, but most will have little or no real impact on performance. Athletes may feel that they prefer a product even when it provides no real benefits.

src: "MRI téh dumasar kana fénoména fisik nu disebat résonansi magnétik nuklir (RMN), ieu kapendak kirang langkung di taun 1930 ku Felix Bloch (damel di Universitas Stanford) sareng Edward Purcell (ti Universitas Harvard). Dina résonansi ieu, médan magnet jeung gelombang radio nyebabkeun atom ngaluarkeun sinyal radio leutik. Dina taun 1970, Raymond Damadian, dokter médis sareng panaliti, mendakan dasar pikeun nganggo penilaian résonansi magnétik minangka pakakas pamariksa médis. 4 taun saatos éta tiasa kenging ijin patén, ieu mangrupa patén nu kahiji dina bidang MRI. Taun 1977, Dr. Damadian ngabereskeun pangwangunan pendeteksi MRI ""saluruh awak"" anu anjeunna pasihan nami ""Indomitable""."
mt: "MRI is based on the physical phenomenon of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered around 1930 by Felix Bloch (at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (at Harvard University). In this resonance, a magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to emit tiny radio signals. In 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and researcher, conceived the idea of using NMR as a medical diagnostic tool. Four years later, he was granted a patent for the first MRI scanner. In 1977, Dr. Damadian built a whole-body MRI scanner which he named "Indomitable"."
ref: MRI is based on a physics phenomenon called nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), which was discovered in the 1930s by Felix Bloch (working at Stanford University) and Edward Purcell (from Harvard University). In this resonance, magnetic field and radio waves cause atoms to give off tiny radio signals. In the year 1970, Raymond Damadian, a medical doctor and research scientist, discovered the basis for using magnetic resonance imaging as a tool for medical diagnosis. Four years later a patent was granted, which was the world's first patent issued in the field of MRI. In 1977, Dr. Damadian completed the construction of the first “whole-body” MRI scanner, which he called the ”Indomitable”.

src: Sajauh ieu, jelema nyaéta makhluk anu pangpinterna dina maca pikiran nu lainna. Éta hartosna arurang tiasa suksés ngaduga naon anu jalmi sanés tingali, maksudkeun, percaya, nyaho, atanapi kahoyongna. Di antawis pangabisa-pangabisa ieu, nyarti kana niat batur téh peryogi pisan. Ieu ngamungkinkeun urang sanggem nyanghareupan ambiguitas tina tindakan fisik. Contona, upami anjeun ningali aya jelema anu mepeskeun kaca mobil, anjeun pasti nyangka manéhna téh keur maok mobil batur. anjeunna kudu dihakimi sacara berbeda lamun anjeunna kaleungitan konci mobil na sareng eta teh mobil anjeunna anu di peupeuskeun kacana
mt: Humans are the most intelligent of all beings in reading minds that are not theirs. This means that one can successfully guess what others are thinking, that is, believe, know, or assume. Among the most powerful of these, it is easy to understand the intentions of others. This allows us to interpret ambiguities in physical actions. For example, if you see someone throwing a car window, you must assume that he is trying to break into a car. You must be judged differently if you are mistaken about the car and this is your car that is being broken into.
ref: Humans are by far the most talented species in reading the minds of others. That means we are able to successfully predict what other humans perceive, intend, believe, know or desire. Among these abilities, understanding the intention of others is crucial. It allows us to resolve possible ambiguities of physical actions. For example, if you were to see someone breaking a car window, you would probably assume he was trying to steal a stranger’s car. He would need to be judged differently if he had lost his car keys and it was his own car that he was trying to break into.

src: Sanajan AI gaduh konotasi fiksi ilmiah anu kuat, AI ngabentuk cabang ilmiah komputer anu penting, urusana sareng tingkah laku, cara diajar sareng adaptasi calakan dina mesin. Penelitian dina AI ngalibatkeun nyieun mesin keur ngaotomatiskeun padamelan nu ngabutuhkeun kacerdasan jalmi. contona kaasup kontrol, perencanaan sarta penjadwalan, pangabisa kanggo ngawalon diagnosa sarta patarosan langganan, sarta ngawanohan seratan panangan, soanten sarta beungeut. Perkara anu sapertos kitu téh tos janten kaélmuan anu kapisah, anu khusus pikeun nyadiakeun solusi pikeun masalah anu nyata. Sistem AI téh ayeuna sering dianggo dina ékonomi, ubar, rékayasa sareng militér, sabab parantos diwangun kana sababaraha aplikasi komputer bumi sareng parangkat lunak video game.
mt: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms an important branch of computer science, cognitive science, and artificial intelligence. Research in AI involves designing intelligent machines that can think and act like humans. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, diagnosis and repair, and natural language processing. Such problems are often studied in the context of applied mathematics, operations research, and software engineering. AI is also used in economics, medicine, engineering, and the military, as it is built on many real-world applications and video game software.
ref: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine. Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior. Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face. Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems. The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.

src: Pola mikir konvergen nyaéta téknik ngaréngsékeun masalah anu ngahijikeun sagala rupa ide atanapi widang kanggo mendak solusi. Fokus dina pola pikir ieu nyaéta kecepatan, logika sareng akurasi, ogé mikawanoh kanyataan, nerapkeun deui téhnik anu geus aya, ngumpulkeun inpormasi Anu paling penting dina pola pikir ieu nyaéta: jawaban anu bener ngan saya hiji. anjeun ngan ukur mikiran dua jawaban, nyaeta bener atawa salah. Pamikiran jenis ieu dipatalikeun sareng prosedur elmu atanapi standar anu tangtu. Jalmi anu pamikirana sapertos kieu gaduh pamikiran logis, anu mampu ngemutkeun pola, mereskeun masalah sareng ngerjakeun tés-tés ilmiah.
mt: Convergent thinking is a technique for solving problems by combining various ideas or fields of knowledge to arrive at a solution. The focus of this type of thinking is speed, logic and accuracy, as well as knowledge of facts, applying existing techniques, gathering the most important information. This type of thinking is associated with scientific or standard procedures. People who think in this way have logical thinking, which can generate patterns, solve problems and conduct scientific tests.
ref: Convergent thinking patterns are problem solving techniques that unite different ideas or fields to find a solution. The focus of this mindset is speed, logic and accuracy, also identification of facts, reapplying existing techniques, gathering information. The most important factor of this mindset is: there is only one correct answer. You only think of two answers, namely right or wrong. This type of thinking is associated with certain science or standard procedures. People with this type of thinking have logical thinking, are able to memorize patterns, solve problems and work on scientific tests.

src: Kagunaan rékaman pideo parantos ngahasilkeun penemuan-penemuan penting dina interpretasi ekspresi alit, gerakan-gerakan raray anu ngan katingali sababaraha milidetik. Sacara khusus, disebutkeun anjeuntiasa terang éta jalmi ngawadul atawa henteu ku nagsirkeun ekspresi saalit rarayna nu leres. Oliver Sacks, dina suratna nyaeta Pidato Presiden, ngagambarkeun yen kumaha jalma anu teu bisa ngarti kana pidato kusabab otakna kaganggu bisa nganilai kana katulusan jalma anu pidato. Anjeunna malah nyarankeun yén kamampuan sapertos kitu dina napsirkeun kalakuan manusa tiasa dipiboga ku sato sapertos anjing piaraan.
mt: The recording of the video has produced important findings in the interpretation of micro-expressions, subtle movements that can only be seen for a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that it can be seen whether a person is lying or not by reading their micro-expressions. Oliver Sacks, in his letter, describes how people who cannot understand a speech because their brains are damaged can only interpret the sincerity of a person who speaks. He also recommends that the ability to do something like this in interpreting human behavior can be used by animals such as dogs.
ref: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds. In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly. Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately. He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.

src: Sapertos kamampuan keur menang élmu sareng diajar perubahan anu sedemikian rupa sapertos anu disebatkeun di luhur dimana pengetahuan éta kagéntos. Pendekatan pikeun kéngingkeun inpormasi téh atos berbéda. Teu aya deui tekanan dina émutan masing-masing, tapi kamampuan nginget tulisan janten fokusna. Intina mah, Renaisans ngarobih seueur dina cara diajar sareng nyebarkeun élmu.
mt: As the ability to learn and teach change so dramatically as described above, the approach to obtaining information varies. There is no pressure on each individual, but the ability to remember writing becomes the focus. In fact, the Renaissance revolutionized the way of teaching and spreading knowledge.
ref: As the ability to obtain knowledge and to learn changed in such a way as mentioned above the base rate at which knowledge was obtained changed. The approach to obtaining information was different. No longer did pressure reside within individual recall, but the ability to recall text became more of a focus. In essence, the Renaissance made a significant change in the approach to learning and the dissemination of knowledge.

src: "Internét ngagabungkeun duanana unsur komunikasi massa sareng antarpribadi. Ciri nu béda ti Internét ngajuru ka diménsi tambahan dina hal pamakéan sareng cara gratipikasi. Contona, ""diajar"" jeung ""sosialisasi"" disarankeun janten motivasi penting keur nganggo internét (James jeung nu sanés., 1995). Kalibetan jalmi"" sareng ""hubungan nu teras"" téh dianggep hal anu nyieun sumanget ku Eighmey sareng McCord (1998) basa éta aranjeunna mariksa kumaha urang réaksi kana website."
mt: "The Internet combines two of the elements of mass and interpersonal communication. The distinguishing feature of the Internet is its extension into a new dimension of use and gratification. For example, "learning" and "socialization" are suggested as important motivations for using the Internet (James and others, 1995). "Self-actualization" and "relationship enhancement" are considered to be the most important of Eighmey and McCord (1998) as they examined how people react to websites."
ref: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication. The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach. For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995). “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.

src: Gaya gothic puncak na dina antawis abad ka 10 - 11 sareng abad ka-14. Mimitina pakean kuat dipangaruhan ku budaya Byzantine di wétan. Nanging, kusabab ku saluran komunikasi na teh laun, gaya anu aya di kulon tiasa katinggaleun 25 dugi 30 taun. nyanghareupan panungtung Abad Panengahan, Eropa Kulon mimiti ngembangkeun gaya anjeunna nyalira. Hiji perkembangan anu paling ageung nyaéta jalmi-jalmi mulai nganggé kancing supados enggal di acuk na.
mt: Gothic fashion peaked in the 10th and 11th centuries and the 14th. Initially influenced by Byzantine culture in the east, styles in the west could take up to 25 to 30 years to catch up. In the wake of the High Middle Ages, Western Europe began to develop its own style. The most significant development was the introduction of buttons so that garments could be fastened.
ref: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century. At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east. However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year. towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.

src: Urang tiasa mulai hirup anu langkung ramah lingkungan, urang tiasa ngiringan gerakan ramah lingkungan, teras urang bahkan tiasa janten pembela ramah lingkungan pikeun ngirangan kasengsaraan ka hareupna dina sababaraha tingkat nu tangtu. ieu siga pangobatan gejala dina sagala hal. tapi, lamun urang alim saukur solusi anu sementara, maka urang kudu neangan akar masalahna, teras kedah di singkirkeun eta masalahna Jelas pisan yén dunya parantos seueur robih kusabab kamajuan élmu manusa sareng téknologi, sareng masalahna janten langkung ageung kusabab seueur penduduk sareng gaya hirup anu boros umat manusa.
mt: We can start living a more environmentally friendly life, we can support the environmental movement, then we can even become environmental activists to reduce suffering in front of us at several levels. This is like treating symptoms in all things. But if we only seek temporary solutions, then we must find the root of the problem, then it must be removed. It is very clear that the world is getting worse because of human progress and technology, and the problem is getting bigger because of the many people and wasteful lifestyles of mankind.
ref: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree. This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them. It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.

src: Kasaimbangan kawasa nyaéta sistem di mana nagara-nagara Éropa ngusahakeun mertahankeun kadaulatan nasional sakumna nagara di Éropa. Konsépna nyaéta yén sadaya nagara Éropa kudu usaha nyegah hiji nagara janten kuat, margi kitu pamarentah nasional sering ngarobah aliansi aranjeunna pikeun ngajaga kasaimbangan. Perang Suksesi Spanyol nandakeun perang mimiti anu masalah utamana nyaeta tentang kekuasaan nu saimbang. Ieu nandakeun parobahan anu penting, sabab kakawasaan Éropa henteu deui gaduh dalih keur perang agama. Kusabab éta, Perang Tilu puluh Taun bakal janten perang terakhir anu dilabélan perang agama.
mt: The Balance of Power is a system in which European nations seek to maintain national sovereignty over all of Europe. The concept is that all European nations should strive to prevent any nation from becoming too powerful, thus national governments often change their alliances to maintain the balance. The War of the Spanish Succession was the first war whose main issue was the balance of power. This was a major change, because European power no longer had a pretext for religious war. Thus, the Thirty Years' War will be the last war to be fought as a religious war.
ref: The balance of power was a system in which European nations sought to maintain the national sovereignty of all European states. The concept was that all European nations had to seek to prevent one nation from becoming powerful, and thus national governments often changed their alliances in order to maintain the balance. The War of Spanish Succession marked the first war whose central issue was the balance of power. This marked an important change, as European powers would no longer have the pretext of being religious wars. Thus, the Thirty Years' War would be the last war to be labeled a religious war.

src: Salami periode sajarah Eropa ieu, Gereja Katolik, anu parantos beunghar sareng kuat, diawaskeun sacara raket. Salami langkung ti sarébu taun Kristen parantos ngabeungkeut nagara-nagara Éropa sanajan basa sareng adat na baréda. Kakiatan na anu menyeluruh ngawengku saban jalmi mimiti ti raja dugi rahayat jelata. Hiji prinsip Kristen anu utama nyaéta harta téh kedah dianggo pikeun ngaringankeun penderitaan sareng kamiskinan teras kauangan gereja téh aya kusabab alesan éta. Otoritas pusat garéja dipuseurkeun di Roma langkung ti sarébu taun. Konsentrasi kakuatan sareng artos ieu nyababkeun seueur patarosan ngeunaan ieu ajaran.
mt: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had been powerful and wealthy, was scrutinized closely. Over the course of several centuries, Christianity had lost control of the nations of Europe, despite its language and customs remaining. Its influence encompassed every aspect of life, from kings to commoners. A fundamental Christian principle was that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty, and the church's coffers were full for this reason. The central authority of the church was located in Rome over the course of several centuries. The concentration of power and purpose caused many questions about this doctrine.
ref: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny. For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner. One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason. The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.

src: Raja Louis XVI anu sieun, Ratu Marie Antoinette, dua putra alit anjeunna (umur 11 taun Marie Therese sareng 4 taun Louis-Charles) sareng adi raja, Madam Elizabeth, dina 6 Oktober 1789 dipaksa uih ka Paris ti Versailles ku masa pasar wanoja. Dina kareta,maranehanana ngalakukeun lalampahan balik ka Paris dikurilingan ku segerombolan jalmi ceuceuleuweungan sarta ngajorowokeun anceman ka Raja sarta Ratu. Kalompok massal maksakeun raja sareng ratu ngabuka jandéla gerbong na. Dina hiji waktu, salah sahiji anggota ti gorombolan nempokeun hulu penjaga karajaan anu dipaehan di Versailles dihareupeun ratu anu sieun.
mt: On October 6, 1789, King Louis XVI and Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young sons (age 11 Marie Therese and 4 Louis-Charles) and the king's sister, Madame Elizabeth, were forced to leave Versailles for Paris by a mob of women. In a carriage, they made the journey back to Paris surrounded by a crowd of angry peasants and threatening the king and queen. The mob of women demanded that the king and queen open the window of their carriage. At one point, one of the mob members pointed a gun at the queen's head, who was sitting in the carriage.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Raja Louis XVI anu sieun, Ratu Marie Antoinette, dua putra alit anjeunna (umur 11 taun Marie Therese sareng 4 taun Louis-Charles) sareng adi raja, Madam Elizabeth, dina 6 Oktober 1789 dipaksa uih ka Paris ti Versailles ku masa pasar wanoja. Dina kareta,maranehanana ngalakukeun lalampahan balik ka Paris dikurilingan ku segerombolan jalmi ceuceuleuweungan sarta ngajorowokeun anceman ka Raja sarta Ratu. Kalompok massal maksakeun raja sareng ratu ngabuka jandéla gerbong na. Dina hiji waktu, salah sahiji anggota ti gorombolan nempokeun hulu penjaga karajaan anu dipaehan di Versailles dihareupeun ratu anu sieun.
mt: On October 6, 1789, King Louis XVI and Queen Marie Antoinette, their two young sons (age 11 Marie Therese and 4 Louis-Charles) and the king's sister, Madame Elizabeth, were forced to leave Versailles for Paris by a mob of women. In a carriage, they made the journey back to Paris surrounded by a crowd of angry peasants and threatening the king and queen. The mob of women demanded that the king and queen open the window of their carriage. At one point, one of the mob members pointed a gun at the queen's head, who was sitting in the carriage.
ref: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women. In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen. The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open. At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.

src: Gewat saeunggeus perang peupeus, Inggris ngabejaan blokade laut Jerman. Strategina kabukten epektip, ngereunkeun pasadiaan militer sareng sipil nu penting, sanaos blokade eta ngalanggar hukum Internasional anu di tampi sacara umum dikodifikasi ku sababaraha perjanjian Internasional salami 2 abad kapengker. Britania nerapkeun ranjau di lautna pikeun ngahalangan kapal sejen asup ka wilayahna, anu bisa nyebabkeun kaancuran kitu deui pikeun kapal anu netral. Kusabab respon kabatas ku taktik ieu, Jerman ngarepkeun respon anu sami pikeun perang kapal selam anu teu dibatesan.
mt: The British blockade of German shipping during the war was a successful strategy, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although it violated international law, which had been codified in a number of international treaties over the previous two centuries. Britain laid mines in its waters to prevent enemy ships from entering, which also affected neutral ships. Because of this response, Germany responded with an undeclared submarine war.
ref: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany. The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries. Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships. Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.

src: Di sakumna Amérika Serikat, aya kira-kira 400.000 kasus Multiple Sclerosis (MS), ngajadikeunna salaku panyawat sarap anu panglobana nyerang jalmi déwasa sareng nu rada kolot. MS nyaéta panyakit anu nyerang sistem sarap pusat, anu termasuk polo, sumsum tulang pengker, sarta sarap optik. Panilitian mendakan yén awéwé dua kali kamungkinan gaduh MS tibatan lalaki.
mt: In the United States, there are approximately 400,000 cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), making it the most common disease affecting young adults and the elderly. MS is a disease that attacks the central nervous system, including the brain, spinal cord, and optic nerves. Research suggests that women are twice as likely to have MS as men.
ref: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults. MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve. Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.

src: Penelitian manggihan nyaeta depresi, sieun jeung bencana ngahubungkeun nyeri jeung kacacatan anu ngabogaan nyeri tonggong bagian handap. Ngan ukur akibat ti bencana, sanés déprési sareng kasieun anu bersarat ti sési PA nu terstruktur anu rutin mingguan. Aranjeunna anu ngiringan dina aktivitas biasa kedah narima dukungan langkung dina pikiran goréng terhadao nyeri ngabédakeun antara nyeri parah sareng rarasaan teu nyaman ti gerakan awak anu biasa waé.
mt: The study found that depression, suicide and disaster are associated with pain and disability. Only the effects of disaster, not depression and suicide, were found to be associated with pain and disability. Those who are involved in normal activities must accept more support in the mind to overcome pain distinguishing between severe pain and uncomfortable feelings of normal body movement.
ref: The study found that depression, fear and catastrophising mediated the relationship between pain and disability in lower back pain sufferers. Only the effects of catastrophizing, not depression and fear was conditional of regular weekly structured PA sessions. Those participating in regular activity required more support in terms of negative perception of pain distinguishing the differences of chronic pain and discomfort feel from normal physical movement.

src: Anggar modern dimaénkeun di sagala rupa tingkat, ti mahasiswa anu diajar di paguron luhur nepi ka kompetisi profésional sareng Olimpiade. Olahraga ieu biasana tanding, hiji pamaén anggar ngalawan anu sanés.
mt: Fencing is played at all levels, from students being taught at universities to professional competitions and the Olympics. This sport is usually a duel, one fencer against another.
ref: The modern sport of fencing is played at many levels, from students learning at a university to professional and Olympic competition. The sport is primarily played in a duel format, one fencer dueling another.

src: Karacunan internal teu tiasa langsung katingali. Gejala, sapertos utah cekap umum ku kituna diagnosis langsung henteu tiasa didamel. Indikasi pangsaéna peracunan lebet nyaéta ayana wadah obat kabuka anu dieusian ku ubar atanapi bahan kimia rumah tangga anu beracun. Pariksa labél keur paréntah pitulung mimiti pikeun racun khusus éta.
mt: Internal poisoning cannot be immediately seen. Symptoms, such as common knowledge of the general public, can not be made directly. Indications of internal poisoning are the presence of open drug containers that are contaminated with drugs or household chemicals that are poisonous. Check the label for first aid instructions for that specific poison.
ref: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made. The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals. Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.

src: Pikeun mariksa korban, anjeun mimiti kedah naliti tempatna pikeun mastikeun kasalametan anjeun. Anjeun kudu perhatoskeun posisi korban nalika ngadekeutan korban jeung perhatoskeun oge bendera bereum otomatis. Upami anjeun nyeuri kusabab ngabantosan, anjeun ngan saukur ngajantenkeun masalah langkung parah.
mt: To check on the victim, you first need to determine the location of the victim to assess the situation. You should also be aware of the automatic emergency brake. If you are the cause of the accident, you should only report the more serious problem.
ref: To Check the victim, you must first survey the scene to ensure your safety. You need to notice the victim's position as you approach him or her and any automatic red flags. If you get hurt trying to help, you may only serve to make matters worse.

src: Aya seueur épék sosial sareng politik sapertos pamakéan sistem métrik, peralihan ti absolutisme ka républikanisme, nasionalisme, sareng kapercayaan yén nagara nyaéta milik rahayat tinimbang ti hiji pamimpin tunggal. Oge saatos Penjajahan Revolusi kabuka pikeun sadaya palamar lalaki anu ngamungkinkeun anu paling ambisius sareng sukses pikeun sukses. Hal anu sami ogé berlaku keur militér kusabab alih-alih pangkat diurutkeun tina kelas ayeuna mah jadi diukur sesuai kamampuan. Revolusi Perancis oge nginspirasi seueur padamel ti nagara sanes keur ngamimitian parubahan sorangan.
mt: There were many social and political changes such as the adoption of the metric system, the transition from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism, and the belief that the nation belonged to the people rather than to a single leader. After the Revolution, the gates were opened to all male applicants who were able to be ambitious and successful. The same was true for the military, as instead of rank being ordered by class, it was measured according to ability. The French Revolution also inspired many other countries to begin their own changes.
ref: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler. Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed. Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber. The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.

src: Kabeh ge milu ulu biung ka masarakat jeung nganggo alat transportasi umum. Hampir sakabehna jalma ngeluhkeun sistem transportasi Di nagara maju anjeun jarang nguping kahumandeuar anu sami ngeunaan kualitas cai atawa jembatan anu runtuh. Naha sistem transportasi téh naékkeun keluhan sapertos kitu, naha gagal unggal dinten? Naha insinyur transportasi ngan henteu kompetén? Atanapi aya anu langkung dasar kajadian?
mt: All of us are part of the community and use public transport. Almost everyone complains about the quality of water or bridges that collapse. Why does the transport system fail so often? Are transport engineers incompetent? Or is there something more fundamental going on?
ref: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems. In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down. Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?

src: Aliran Lalu lintas mangrupikeun ulikan ngeunaan gerakan panggerak sareng kandaraan individu antara 2 poin sareng interaksi hubungan 1 jeung nu lainna. Hanjakalna, diajar alur lalulintas téh sesah kusabab kalakuan jurumudina teu tiasa diprediksi kapastianna 1 persén. Untungna, supir condong kana perilaku anu cukup konsisten; samentawis kitu, arus lalu lintas condong gaduh konsistensi anu wajar sareng kasarna tiasa digambarkeun secara matematis. Pikeun langkung jéntré ngagambarkeun arus lalar, hubungan parantos didamel dina tilu ciri utami: (1) arus, (2) kapadetan, sareng (3) kecepatan. Hubungan ieu ngabantu dina perencanaan, rarancangan, jeung operasina fasilitas jalan raya.
mt: Traffic flow is the study of how vehicles move and interact on roads and highways. However, the behavior of drivers cannot be predicted with 1% accuracy. Fortunately, drivers tend to be consistent in their behavior; at the same time, traffic tends to be consistent and can be modeled mathematically. To better model traffic, three main characteristics are made: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) speed. These relationships help in planning, designing, and operating road facilities.
ref: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another. Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty. Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically. To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity. These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.

src: Eksperimen The Hersheydan Chase salah sahiji panalungtikan anu ngungkapkeun margi DNA nyaeta materi genetik. Hershey sareng Chase nganggo fag, atanapi virus, pikeun nyisipkeun DNA aranjeunna ka baktéri. Aranjeunna nyobian dua percobaan anu nandaan DNA dina phage nu aya fosfor radioaktif atawa protéin tina phage nu aya walirang radioaktif.
mt: The Hershey-Chase experiment was one of the experiments that revealed DNA as the genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phage, or viruses, to inject DNA into bacteria. They tried two experiments that labeled DNA with radioactive phosphorus or protein with radioactive sulfur.
ref: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material. Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium. They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.

src: Mutasi tiasa gaduh sababaraha epek beda gumantung kana jenis mutasina, pentingna bahan genetik anu dipangaruhan sareng naha sel anu dipangaruhan ku sel nu lainna. Ngan mutasi dina sél garis kuman anu tiasa diturunkeun ka murangkalih, sedengkeun mutasi di tempat sanésna tiasa nyababkeun sélna maot atanapi kanker.
mt: The effects of a mutation can vary depending on the type of mutation, the importance of the affected genetic material and whether the affected cell is affected by another cell. Only mutations in germ cells can be passed on to offspring, while mutations in other places can cause the cell to die or cancer.
ref: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells. Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.

src: Embé kos namah partama kali dipiara téh kirang langkung 10.000 taun kapungkur di Gunung Zagros di Iran. kabeh budaya jeung suku baheula nu ngamimitian gampangna milarian susu, buuk, daging, sareng kulit Embé jinak umumna dipiara dina gerombolan anu dilepas di daérah perbukitan atawa daerah nganggon nu séjénna, biasa dianggon ku budak leutik atanapi nu budak rada gedé, mirip jeung tukang nganggon nu batur apal. Cara nganggon siga kieu masih kénéh dipaké nepi ayeuna.

Domestication of cattle likely took place in the Middle East, where the earliest evidence of domestication has been found.  The earliest evidence of domesticated cattle in the Middle East comes from the site of Jericho, where a bone fragment was found that was dated to 9,000 years ago. ref: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran. Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins. Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.

src: Golf nyaéta permaénan anu dimana pemaénna nganggo stik keur nepak bola ka lobang. Dalapan belas liang diheureuykeun salila puteran reguler, jeung pamaen biasana dimimitian kana liang kahiji jeung akhirna di liang ka dalapan belas. Pamaen anu neunggeulan bola golf nu paling sakedik, atawa ayunan stikna ti klub, kanggo ngabereskeun permainan, manehna nu meunang. Kaulinan ieu dipaénkeun dina jukut, sareng jukut di sakitar liang dipotong langkung pondok sareng disebat héjo.
mt: Golf is a game in which players use a stick to hit a ball into a hole. Eighteen holes are played in a regular round, and players usually begin on the first hole and end on the eighteenth. The player who hits the ball into the hole with the fewest strokes, or swings of the stick, wins the game. This game is played on a course, and the course is divided into sections called holes, which are marked by green.
ref: Golf is a game in which players use clubs to hit balls into holes. Eighteen holes are played during a regular round, with players usually starting on the first hole on the course and finishing on the eighteenth. The player who takes the fewest strokes, or swings of the club, to complete the course wins. The game is played on grass, and the grass around the hole is mown shorter and called the green.

src: Tujuan utama elmu teh kanggo manggihan kumaha jalanna dunya iyeu lewat cara nu ilmiah. sabenerna cara iyeu jadi pitunjuk kanggo lolobana panalungtikan ilmiah. Éta henteu nyalira, ékspérimén, sareng ékspérimén mangrupikeun tés anu digunakeun pikeun ngaleungitkeun hiji atanapi langkung kamungkinan hipotésis, naroskeun patarosan, sareng ngajantenkeun pengamatan sarta ogé ngabimbing panilitian ilmiah.
mt: The main goal of science is to understand how the world works through the scientific method.  This is not an experiment, nor is an experiment a test of a hypothesis, nor is a hypothesis a testable statement, nor is a testable statement a scientific theory.  A scientific theory is a well-substantiated explanation of some aspect of the natural world, based on a body of facts that have been repeatedly confirmed and accepted by scientists.  Theories can be proven false, but they can never be proven true.  Theories are not guesses, nor are they hunches.  They are the result of a long process of observation, experimentation, and analysis.  Theories are not the same as hypotheses, which are tentative answers to scientific questions.  Hypotheses are not the same as educated guesses, which are not the same as guesses.  Guesses are not the same as predictions, which are not the same as forecasts.  Forecasts are not the same as projections, which are not the same as estimates.  Estimates are not the same as approximations, which are not the same as approximations.  Approximations are not the same as approximations.  Approximations are not the same as approximations.  Approximations are not the same as approximations. ref: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research. It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.

src: Tujuan utama elmu teh kanggo manggihan kumaha jalanna dunya iyeu lewat cara nu ilmiah. sabenerna cara iyeu jadi pitunjuk kanggo lolobana panalungtikan ilmiah. Éta henteu nyalira, ékspérimén, sareng ékspérimén mangrupikeun tés anu digunakeun pikeun ngaleungitkeun hiji atanapi langkung kamungkinan hipotésis, naroskeun patarosan, sareng ngajantenkeun pengamatan sarta ogé ngabimbing panilitian ilmiah.

src: Angin topan ngancurkeun daerah nu langkung alit tibatan badai anu lain, tapi tiasa ngancurkeun kabéh anu aya dina jalurna. Tornado nyabut tangkal, nyoekkeun papan ti gedong, sarta ngapungkeun mobil ka langit. 2 persen tornado nu mawi kejem lumangsung langkung ti 3 jam. Badai monster iyeu boga angin nu kecepatanna nepikeun ka 480 km/jam (133 m/detik; 300 mph).
mt: A tornado can devastate a small area compared to a hurricane, but can devastate everything in its path. Tornadoes rip trees from the ground, tear roofs from buildings, and lift cars into the air. Two percent of the most violent tornadoes last more than three hours. This monster storm had winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).
ref: Tornadoes strike a small area compared to other violent storms, but they can destroy everything in their path. Tornadoes uproot trees, rip boards from buildings, and fling cars up into the sky. The most violent two percent of tornadoes last more than three hours. These monster storms have winds up to 480 km/h (133 m/s; 300 mph).

src: Jelema tos ngajieun jeung nganggo lensa keur ngagedekeun mang rebu-rebu taun. Tapi, téléskop anu bener mimiti dijieun di Éropa di ahir abad ka-16. Téléskop-téléskop ieu nganggo gabungan ti dua lensa supados objék anu tebih tiasa katingal caket sareng ageung.
mt: People have been making and using lenses to magnify objects for centuries. But the first true telescope was invented in Europe in the late 16th century. These early telescopes used a combination of two lenses so that distant objects could be seen up close and large.
ref: Humans have been making and using lenses for magnification for thousands and thousands of years. However, the first true telescopes were made in Europe in the late 16th century. These telescopes used a combination of two lenses to make distant objects appear both nearer and larger.

src: "Muhammad téh resep pisan kana sagala rupi hal anu teu biasa dina kahirupan duniawi. Anjeunna sering dongkap ka hiji gua nu ayeuna disebat ""Hira"" dina gunung ""Noor"" (cahya) kanggo méditasi. Guha éta sorangan, anu salamet ti jaman ka jaman, masihan gambaran ngeunaan arah spiritual Muhammad. Lokasina dina salah 1 puncak gunung belah kaler Mekkah, guha ieu terasing pisan tina dunya luar. Nyatana, eta henteu gampang mendakanana pisan sanaos aya 1 nu terang perkawis eta. Sakali jero guha, eta teh terasing total. Teu aya anu tiasa ditingali salain langit anu jelas sareng éndah di luhur sareng seueur gunung di sakurilingna. Saeutik pisan dunya ieu tiasa ditingali atanapi didangu ti jero guha."
mt: "Muhammad was very fond of all kinds of unusual things in worldly life. He was often captured to a cave called "Hira" on the mountain "Noor" (light) for meditation. This cave itself, which has survived from time to time, has provided spiritual guidance to Muhammad. Its location is on one of the peaks of the northern mountains of Mecca, this cave is very isolated from the outside world. Indeed, it is not easy to reach there, but there is one who can find it. Once inside the cave, it is totally isolated. There is nothing to see except the clear and beautiful sky above and several mountains around it. This world can be seen or viewed from inside the cave."
ref: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation. he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations. Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world. In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation. Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.

src: Wagonway diwangun di Inggris dina mimiti abad ka-16. Sanajan gerobak mung didamel ti papan kayu anu sajajar hungkul, tapi bakal tiasa ngadamel kuda pikeun langkung gancang sareng narik beban anu langkung beurat tibatan di jalan butut. Crossties diwanohkeun cekap mimiti kanggo nahan trek di tempatna. Nanging, laun laun disadari yen lintasan bakal langkung efisien lamun aya beusi di luhurna. Ieu téh atos janten praktik anu biasa, tapina beusi téh nyieun langkung seueur karuksakan kana roda kayu gerobakna. Ahirna, kikiping kai atos digantikeun ku kikiping beusi. Dina 1767, rel kahiji anu sapinuhna beusi diwanohkeun.
mt: Wagonways were built in England in the 16th century. Although the wagons were made of nothing more than wooden planks laid side by side, they could pull horses faster and haul heavier loads than on dirt roads. Cross-ties were first used to keep the track in place. However, it was eventually realized that rails would be more efficient if they were made of iron. This became standard practice, but iron rails caused more damage to wooden wagon wheels. Eventually, wooden rails were replaced by iron rails. In 1767, the first iron rail was laid.
ref: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century. Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day. Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top. This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons. Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
