src: Romantisme boga unsur budaya determinisme anu lega, digambarkeun ku penulis sapertos Goethe, Fischte, jeung Schlegel. Dina kontéks Romantisisme, géografi ngawangun individu. Sinareng antukna adat jeung budaya anu aya hubungannana jeung ieu géografi timbul, maka sagala hal anu disebatkeun tadi saluyu jeung tempat masarakat, langkung saé tibatan hukum anu diberlakukeun sakama-kama.
mt: Romanticism has a large cultural element of determinism, depicted by writers such as Goethe, Fischte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, geography shapes individuals. Therefore, customs and cultures that are related to this geography arise, so all that is said above is in accordance with the place of the people, rather than laws that are applied generally.
ref: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel. In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.

src: "Determinisme téknologi mangrupikeun istilah anu nyakup sababaraha ideu dina praktékna, mimitian ti sorongan téknologi atanapi téknologi teras rarasaan anu kuat yén takdir manusa disorong ku logika dasar anu aya hubunganana sareng hukum ilmiah sareng wujudna dina téknologi. kalolobaan interpretasi determinisme teknologi ngabogaan 2 ide umum: yen pangembangan teknologi eta sorangan ngiring jalan anu kalolobaan di pangaruhan budaya atawa pulitik, sarta yen teknologi dina giliran na ngabogaan ""efek"" dina balarea anu salawasna, batan dikaayaankeun sacara sosial. Contona, manawi hiji jalmi ngecap yen mobil teh peryogi ngarah ka pangembangan jalan. Tapi, jaringan jalan nasional henteu layak sacara ékonomi keur sababaraha mobil hungkul, janten métode anyar dina produksina dikembangkeun pikeun ngirangan biaya kapamilikan mobil. Pamilik mobil masal ogé nyababkeun kacilakaan anu leuwih luhur dina kacilakaan di jalan, ieu ngarahkeun ka panemuan téknik anyar dina perawatan kaséhatan pikeun ngalereskeun awak mobil anu ruksak."
mt: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses several ideas in its practice, beginning with the technology itself or the technology that is currently dominant that seems to dictate the path of human destiny in relation to the laws of science and its form in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism have two common ideas: that the development of technology itself drives cultural or political change, and that technology has "effects" on the world, at least in the short term, regardless of its social cost. For example, if a person decides that cars are good for road development. But, the national road network is not economically viable for many cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Car owners also cause higher rates of accidents on the road, leading to the development of new techniques in health care to deal with the damage of car accidents."
ref: "Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology. Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has ""effects"" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned. For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads. However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership. Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies."

src: "Lambang panah"" sapertos hurup V sareng ""panah handap"" sapertos tumpukan atanapi kuadrat anu parantos kaleungitan sisi handap. Kaluhur hartosna anjeun kedah mimitian dina ujung sareng nyorong busur na, sareng ka handap hartosna anjeun kedah mimitian dina handap (anu dimana panangan anjeun nyepengan busur) teras narik busur. Gésékan kaluhur téh biasana ngasilkeun sora anu laun lembut upami gésékan ka handap ngasilkeun sora anu tarik teges. Mangga wae upami bade ngagambar ciri anjeun nyalira, tapi emut, ciri melengkung anu tos dicetak ayana kusabab musik, janten biasana kudu dihargaan."
mt: "The up arrow" as the V and "down arrow" as the stack or square which loses the bottom side. If the meaning is to start at the tip and pull the bow, and the bottom meaning is to start at the bottom (where the bow is drawn) then pull the bow. The up arrow usually produces a soft sound if the up arrow produces a sound that pulls the meaning. Please note if you want to draw your own signs, but the curved sign that is printed because of the music, so it usually has to be appreciated."
ref: "The ""up bow"" mark looks like a V and the ""down bow mark"" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side. Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow. An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive. Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected."

src: Beda sareng primata anu lainna, hominid henteu nganggo deui leungeunna pikeun gerak atanapi nahan beurat atanapi ayun-ayunan dina tangkal. Leungeun jeung suku simpanse ngabogaan ukuran jeung panjang anu sarua, nyerminkeun pamakéan leungeun kanggo nahan beban keur leumpang maké ramo. leungeun jelema leuwih pondok tibatan sukuna, jeung tulangna leuwih lempeng Tulang panangan fosil yuswana 2 dugi 3 juta warsih ngungkabkeun pergeseran spesialisasi panangan ieu ti penggerak ka manipulasi.
mt: Unlike other primates, hominids do not use their hands for locomotion or to support weight or sway in trees. The hands and feet of chimpanzees have similar size and length, indicating the use of hands for supporting weight for climbing. Human hands are more compact than their feet, and their bones are more flattened. Fossilized wrist bones from 2 to 3 million years ago indicate this shift in specialization from locomotion to manipulation.
ref: Unlike other primates, hominids no longer use their hands in locomotion or bearing weight or swinging through the trees. The chimpanzee's hand and foot are similar in size and length, reflecting the hand's use for bearing weight in knuckle walking. The human hand is shorter than the foot, with straighter phalanges. Fossil hand bones two million to three million years old reveal this shift in specialization of the hand from locomotion to manipulation.

src: Panalitian abad dua puluh nunjukeun yén aya dua kelompok variasi genetik: anu nyumput sareng muncul. Mutasi téh nambihan jenis génétik nu anyar, teras séléksi ngahapus éta tina kumpulan jenis anu ditunjukkeun. Segregasi sareng kombinasi ulang diacak bulak balik diantara dua kelompok sareng unggal generasi.
mt: 20th century research showed that there are two groups of genetic variation: those that hide and those that appear. Mutations add new genetic types, then selection removes them from the designated group. Segregation and recombination are shuffled back and forth between the two groups and each generation.
ref: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed. Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation. Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.

src: Lamun kaluar ti padang, bakal hésé keur monyet nu pencernaanna hampir sarua jiga jelema keur minuhan kabutuhan asam aminona tina sumber daya pelakan nu aya. Selain éta, gagal ngalakukeun hal éta téh ganjaranna serius: mulai depresi, kirang giji, teras akhirna maot. Sumber tutuwuhan anu paling bisa diaksés nyaéta protéin anu tiasa diaksés ku daun sareng kacang, tapi ieu sesah kangge primata sapertos urang nyerna kacuali anu atos di pasak. Sabalikna, daangeun sato (sireum, rinyuh, endog) moal arek babari dicerna, tapi oge nyuplai loba protein anu ngandung kabeh asam amino esensial. Upami tos ngemutan sagala rupi, kedahna urang teu reuwas deui pas terang yen karuhun urang téh kenging protein carana rada mirip sareng carana simpanse dina sabana.
mt: When they leave the forest, it will be difficult for monkeys whose digestive systems are almost identical to humans to obtain the amino acids they need from the available plant resources. In addition, failure to do so has serious consequences: depression, malnutrition, and eventually death. The most accessible source of protein is found in leaves and nuts, but these are not easily digested by primates such as humans, except for those that are roasted. On the other hand, eggs (chicken, duck, quail) are not easily digested, but they also provide a lot of protein containing all essential amino acids. If we are to survive, we must not forget that our ancestors were also monkeys in the savanna.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Lamun kaluar ti padang, bakal hésé keur monyet nu pencernaanna hampir sarua jiga jelema keur minuhan kabutuhan asam aminona tina sumber daya pelakan nu aya. Selain éta, gagal ngalakukeun hal éta téh ganjaranna serius: mulai depresi, kirang giji, teras akhirna maot. Sumber tutuwuhan anu paling bisa diaksés nyaéta protéin anu tiasa diaksés ku daun sareng kacang, tapi ieu sesah kangge primata sapertos urang nyerna kacuali anu atos di pasak. Sabalikna, daangeun sato (sireum, rinyuh, endog) moal arek babari dicerna, tapi oge nyuplai loba protein anu ngandung kabeh asam amino esensial. Upami tos ngemutan sagala rupi, kedahna urang teu reuwas deui pas terang yen karuhun urang téh kenging protein carana rada mirip sareng carana simpanse dina sabana.
mt: When they leave the forest, it will be difficult for monkeys whose digestive systems are almost identical to humans to obtain the amino acids they need from the available plant resources. In addition, failure to do so has serious consequences: depression, malnutrition, and eventually death. The most accessible source of protein is found in leaves and nuts, but these are not easily digested by primates such as humans, except for those that are roasted. On the other hand, eggs (chicken, duck, quail) are not easily digested, but they also provide a lot of protein containing all essential amino acids. If we are to survive, we must not forget that our ancestors were also monkeys in the savanna.
ref: "Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources. Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death. The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked. In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids. All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their ""protein problem"" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today."

src: Subkultur ngamajukeun jalma-jalma anu mikiran anu resep anu ngarasa diabaikan ku standar masarakat sareng ngawenangkeun rasa diri. Subkultur dibédakeun gumantung kana yuswana, suku bangsana, kelasna, lokasina, sareng/atanapi génder anggotana. Kualitas anu nangtukeun subkultur salaku bédana panginten basa, éstétis, religius, politik, séks, géografis, atanapi kombinasi faktor. Anggota subkultur mineung nunjukeun tanda kaanggotaan aranjeunna nganggo gaya anu khas sareng simbolis, anu ngacakup pakéan, tingkah laku, sareng argot.
mt: A subculture is a group of people within a culture that differentiates itself from the larger culture to which it belongs through common values, standards, or beliefs regarding cultural artefacts, religious or spiritual practices, language, customs, or other activities considered to be socially meaningful. Subcultures are groupings that result in separate identifications made by their members, or are otherwise differentiated by unique cultural artifacts. Subcultures may be based on distinct cultural identities (ethnic, nationality, religious, or other), or on other factors such as social occupation, gender, age, or common commercial interests. Subcultural members often display their membership through distinctive cultural artifacts, such as clothing, mannerisms, and argot.
ref: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity. Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members. The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors. Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.

src: Barudak ngembangkeun kasadaran ngeunaan ras jeung stereotip ras tileleutik sareng stereotip ieu boga dampak kana kalakuan. Salaku conto, murangkalih anu kalebet ka kaum minoritas dianggap henteu pati saé lamun diajar di sakola, teras saatos aranjeunna apal anggapan nu berhubungan sareng ras éta, aranjeunna bener-bener teu pati pinter di sakolana.
mt: Children develop awareness of race and racial stereotypes at a young age and these stereotypes have an impact on behavior. For example, children who are members of minority groups are perceived as less intelligent if they attend school, then after they learn the stereotype associated with their race, they actually are less intelligent in school.
ref: Children develop an awareness of race and racial stereotypes quite young and these racial stereotypes affect behavior. For instance, children who identify with a racial minority that is stereotyped as not doing well in school tend to not do well in school once they learn about the stereotype associated with their race.

src: "1 metode anu paling umum dipaké pikeun ngagambarkeun pentingna sosialisasi nyaéta ngagunakeun sababaraha kasus barudak miskin, ngaliwatan ngalalaworakeun, kalemahan, atanapi kekerasan anu dihaja, henteu sosialisasi ku urang anu dewasa nalika aranjeunna janten dewasa. Budak anu jiga kitu teh disebat ""liar"" atanapi lingas. loba budak anu lingas sok loba dicarék nu séjén (biasana mah kolotna sorangan); dina sababaraha kasus mah diantepna budak jiga kieu téh kusabab anu jadi kolotna teu tarima kana kaayaan budak anu kurang dina harti kapinteranana atawa kayaan awakna anu henteu sampurna. Barudak liar parantos ngarasakeun dilecehkeun jeung trauma saacan ditinggalkeun atawa kabur. Anu sanésna diduga tos diasuh ku sato; aya anu nyebatkeun hirup di alam liar sosoranganan. Nalika diangkat ku sato sanés ku jalmi, barudak anu liar nunjukkeun tingkah laku (dina wates fisik) ampir sapinuhna sapertos sato anu ngarawatna, sapertos sieunna atanapi acuh ka manusa."
mt: "One of the most common methods of illustrating the importance of socialization is to use several poor children, through neglect, abuse, or violence, not socialized by adults when they become adults. Such children are called "feral" or "wild." Many feral children are often abused by others (usually their own parents); in some cases they are abandoned because their parents do not accept their condition in terms of their intelligence or physical condition. Feral children are likely to experience maltreatment and trauma before being abandoned or running away. They are also believed to be raised by animals; some are said to live in the wild alone. When raised by animals other than humans, feral children exhibit behavior (in physical terms) almost entirely like animals, such as eating or ignoring humans."
ref: "One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up. Such children are called ""feral"" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment. Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away. Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own. When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans."

src: Tatanen Subsistén nyaéta tatanén anu dilaksanakeun pikeun ngahasilkeun pangan anu ngan cekap pikeun nyumponan kabutuhan pokona patani sareng kulawargana. Pertanian subsistén mangrupikeun sistem saderhana, seringna organik, anu ngagunakeun bibit nu disimpen asli tina ekoregion digabungkeun sareng rotasi pepelakan atanapi téknik anu kawilang saderhana pikeun maksimalkeun panén. Sajarahna seuseueurna patani téh padamelanna dijadikeun mata pencaharian sareng anu sapertos kieu masih seueur di nagara-nagara berkembang.
mt: Subsistence farming is farming that is primarily for the subsistence of the family and community. It is a small-scale, labor-intensive, multi-purpose farming system in which nearly all products are used by the farmer and his family and surplus, if any, is sold on a small scale. Its history is that it was the primary form of farming in most of the world until the 20th century, and it still is in many developing countries.
ref: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family. Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield. Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.

src: Tiasa wae pariwisata anu umum pisan nyaeta anu osok dihubungkeun jeung mamangkatan: pariwisata rekreasi. Kieu yeuh nalika jalma indit ka hiji tempat anu beda pisan ti asal manehna nu dipake pikeun nyalse jeung neang kabungah Pantai, taman hiburan jeung bumi perkemahan nyaeta tempat anu pangmineungna didatangan ku para wisatawan. Upami tujuan hiji jalma nganjang ka hiji tempat nyaéta mikaweruh sajarah sareng budayana, maka jinis pariwisata ieu katelah wisata budaya. Wisatawan tiasa nyumpingan tempat wisata anu béda di sababaraha nagara atanapi aranjeunna ngan ukur tiasa milih fokus kana hiji daérah.
mt: Tourism is often used as a synonym for recreation. This is when people travel to a place that is different from their home to relax and enjoy the beach, amusement parks and campgrounds are places that are most visited by tourists. If the purpose of a person visiting a place is to learn about its history and culture, then this type of tourism is called cultural tourism. Tourists can visit different tourist destinations in several countries or they can just focus on one area.
ref: Perhaps the most common type of tourism is what most people associate with traveling: Recreation tourism. This is when people go to a place that is very different from their regular day-to-day life to relax and have fun. Beaches, theme parks and camp grounds are often the most common places frequented by recreational tourists. If the objective of one’s visit to a particular place is to get to know its history and culture then this type of tourism is known as cultural tourism. Tourists may visit different landmarks of a particular country or they may simply opt to focus on just one area.

src: Jalma anu parantos terlibat sababaraha puluh taun ngabantosan urang ngahargaan kakuatan sareng kainginan urang bari jeung aranjeunna jujur nganalisa kasusah sareng kagagalan ogé. Nalika ngadangukeun jalma ngabagi carita, kulawarga, sareng organisasina, urang nampi wawasan anu penting ngeunaan jaman baheula sareng sababaraha kapribadian anu mangaruhan hadé atanapi goréng dina budaya organisasi. Upami diajar hiji sajarah henteu berarti ngartos ogé soal budayana, tapi sahenteuna ngabantu jelema keur ngarasa dimana anjeunna aya di sajarah organisasi éta. Nalika meunteun kasuksésan sareng waspada kana kagagalan, individu sarta sadaya jalmi anu miluan mendak leuwih jero ngenaan peunteun, misi, sarta kakiatan pendorong organisasi. Dina perkawis ieu, ngémut conto-conto paripolah wirausaha anu kawit sareng kasuksésan anu dihasilkeun ngabantuan jalmi kanggo kabuka ka parobihan anu anyar sareng arah anyar kanggo garéja lokal. Carita suksés sapertos éta ngurangan rasa sieun kana parobahan, sakaligus nyiptakeun pikiran positif kana parobahan di masa hareup.
mt: Local people have been involved in the process of valuing the power and desire of people while being honest in analyzing the difficulties and failures as well. When people share stories, families, and their organizations, we gain important insights about the past and some influential personalities in the organization's culture. If you learn a history, it does not mean you also understand the culture, but it certainly helps people to feel where they are in the organization's history. When you celebrate successes and be aware of failures, individuals and all people become more deeply aware of the purpose, mission, and the driving forces of the organization. In this case, examples of entrepreneurial stories and successes produced help people to open to new and new directions for the local church. Stories of success like this reduce fear of change, as well as creating positive thoughts about change in the future.
ref: Individuals who had been involved for several decades helped us appreciate our strengths and passions while candidly assessing difficulties and even failures. While listening to individuals share their individual, family, and organizational stories, we gained valuable insight into the past and some of the personalities who influenced for good or ill the culture of the organization. While understanding one’s history does not assume understanding of culture, it does at least help people gain a sense of where they fall within the history of the organization. While assessing the successes and becoming aware of failures, individuals and the whole of the participating persons discover more deeply the values, mission, and driving forces of the organization. In this instance, recalling previous instances of entrepreneurial behavior and resulting successes helped people to be open to new changes and new direction for the local church. Such success stories lessened the fears of change, while creating positive inclinations toward change in the future.

src: Pendekatan postmodern kanggo diajar nawarkeun kabébasan ti anu mutlak. Teu aya 1 cara anu pangsaéna kanggo diajar. Faktana heunteu aya ngan hiji hal alus pikeun diajar. Dialajar dimeunangkeun ti pangalaman antara diajar jeung pengetahuan anu disayogikeun. Pangalaman urang nepi ka ayeuna kalawan sadaya acara pigawé sorangan sareng penyajian inpormasi, acara tivi dumasar-diajar ngagambarkeun perkawis ieu. Arurang loba ngarasa dimana keur nongton acara tipi anu méré nyaho urang hiji proses atawa pangalaman anu dimana urang ogé moal bakal ngarasakeun pangalaman éta. Urang moal pernah ngarombak mobil, ngawangun air mancur di halaman tukang, ulin ka Peru keur ningali ruruntuhan kuno, atawa ngarobah imah tatangga urang.
mt: A postmodern approach to teaching challenges the notion of absolutes. There is no one best way to teach. The fact is there is no one right way to teach. Teaching is best learned from experience between teaching and knowledge being imparted. Our experience up to now with all the teaching we have done ourselves and the presentation of information, TV shows based on teaching, illustrate this. Many people feel where they are watching a show that gives them knowledge of a process or experience they will never have. We have never rebuilt a car, built a fountain in the yard, gone to Peru to see the ancient ruins, or changed our neighbor's house.
ref: The postmodern approach to learning offers the freedom from absolutes. There is no one good way to learn. In fact, there is not one good thing to learn.Learning takes place in the experience between the learner and the knowledge presented. Our current experience with all the do-it-yourself and information presenting, learning-based television shows illustrates this point. So many of us find ourselves watching a television show that informs us of a process or experience in which we will never participate or apply that knowledge. We will never overhaul a car, build a fountain in our backyard, travel to Peru to examine ancient ruins, or remodel our neighbour's house.

src: Gangguan saré mangrupikeun proses ngahaja hudang salami periode saré normal anjeun sareng saré deui saeunggeus eta dina waktos nu pondok(10-60 menit). Ieu gampil dilakukeun nganggo jam weker nu sepi pikeun ngagugahkeun kasadaran anjeun tanpa bener-bener ngagugahkeun. Upami anjeun ngareset jam nalika bobo, éta jam tiasa disimpen di sisi sanés kamar, éta bakal maksa anjeun kaluar tina ranjang pikeun mareumanana. pilihan anu berdasarkeun Biorythm sejenna nyaeta loba nginum cai(cai herang atau cai teh, anu matak beser) nalika sare, maksa 1 jelema hudang jang papang
mt: Sleep disruption is a process of normal sleep cycle that is interrupted by a short period (10-60 minutes). This can be done by a silent alarm clock to wake you without actually waking. If you reset your alarm when you go to bed, the alarm can be stored on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. A biorythm based option is to drink a lot of water (herbal tea or green tea, which is caffeine free) before bed, forcing one to get up to use the bathroom.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Gangguan saré mangrupikeun proses ngahaja hudang salami periode saré normal anjeun sareng saré deui saeunggeus eta dina waktos nu pondok(10-60 menit). Ieu gampil dilakukeun nganggo jam weker nu sepi pikeun ngagugahkeun kasadaran anjeun tanpa bener-bener ngagugahkeun. Upami anjeun ngareset jam nalika bobo, éta jam tiasa disimpen di sisi sanés kamar, éta bakal maksa anjeun kaluar tina ranjang pikeun mareumanana. pilihan anu berdasarkeun Biorythm sejenna nyaeta loba nginum cai(cai herang atau cai teh, anu matak beser) nalika sare, maksa 1 jelema hudang jang papang
mt: Sleep disruption is a process of normal sleep cycle that is interrupted by a short period (10-60 minutes). This can be done by a silent alarm clock to wake you without actually waking. If you reset your alarm when you go to bed, the alarm can be stored on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. A biorythm based option is to drink a lot of water (herbal tea or green tea, which is caffeine free) before bed, forcing one to get up to use the bathroom.
ref: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes). This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you. If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off. Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.

src: Sababaraha jalmi percanten yén sering ngalaman ngimpen sacara sadar anu diinduksi sacara artifisial téh matak capé pisan. Alesan utama ti fénoména ieu nyaéta hasil tina mimpi nu karasa nyata anu ngalébarkeun jangka waktu diantara kondisi REM. Kalayan kirang REMs per wengi, kaayaan anu anjeun bobo sare sareng pamulihan awak anjeun cukup tiasa janten masalah. Ieu sarua capéna jeung upami anjeun hudang unggal dua puluh atanapi tilu puluh menit pikeun nonton TV. Pangaruhna tergantung kana sabaraha sering uteuk anjeun nyobian ngimpi sadar unggal wengi.
mt: Some people have reported that lucid dreaming is very difficult. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of dreams that feel real that extend the time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, the state of being asleep and body recovery can be a problem. This is similar to the problem of watching TV every twenty or thirty minutes. The effects depend on how often you try to dream lucid every night.
ref: Some people believe that experiencing many artificially induced lucid dreams often enough can be very exhausting. The main reason for this phenomenon is the result of the lucid dreams expanding the length of time between REM states. With fewer REMs per night, this state in which you experience actual sleep and your body recovers becomes infrequent enough to become a problem. This is just as exhausting as if you were to wake up every twenty or thirty minutes and watch TV. The effect is dependent on how often your brain attempts to lucidly dream per night.

src: "Tim maya diayakeun sesuai jeung standar kualitas anu sami jeung tim konvensional, tapi aya béda na saeutik. Anggota tim maya sering gaduh fungsi janten titik kontak kanggo tim fisik langsung. Aranjeunna gaduh hak otonom nu leuwih tibatan anggota tim konvensional nu séjén kumargi aranjeunna tiasa papendak di zona waktu anu béda-beda anu teu tiasa dipikaharti ku managemen lokal. Ayana ""tim gaib"" nu nyata (Larson sareng LaFasto, 1989, h109) ogé mangrupikeun komponen nu unik tina tim virtual. Tim anu henteu katembong"" nyaeta tim manajemen anu sewang-sewang anggota ngalaporkeun. Tim anu teu katembong netepkeun standar kanggo saban anggota."
mt: "The virtual team is formed according to the same quality standards as a conventional team, but there are some differences. Virtual team members often have a dual role as a point of contact for the physical team. They have more autonomy than conventional team members because they can be active in different time zones that cannot be interpreted by local management. The existence of the ""invisible team"" (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p. 109) is also a unique component of the virtual team. The ""invisible team"" maintains standards for each member."
ref: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences. Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group. They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management. The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team. The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.

src: Teori konten dipusatkeun kana milari naon anu nyieun jelema milih atawa menarik keur anjeunna. Téori-téori ieu nunjukeun yén jelema mikaboga kabutuhan sareng/atau kahayang anu dipikayahang ti remaja nepi déwasa. Téori-téori ieu ningalian dina naon anu jalmi-jalmi tertentu hoyong migawé hal nu aranjeunna lakukeun sareng hal naon di sakitaranna nu nyieun aranjeunna ngalakukeun sareng teu ngalakukeun hal tertentu. 2 teori eusi anu populer nyaeta Teori Hirarki dina Kabutuhan Teori sareng 2 Teori Faktor Hertzberg.
mt: Content theory focuses on what makes people choose or be attracted to certain things. These theories suggest that people have needs and/or desires that are satisfied by certain things. These theories observe what certain individuals do and what is around them that makes them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are the Hierarchy of Needs Theory and the Herzberg's Two Factor Theory.
ref: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them. These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood. These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things. Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.

src: Aturan anu nyiksa pisan sareng sering diolok-olakeun mangrupikeun garis panduan anu sederhana dina nyiptakeun dinamisme nalika ngajaga ukuran dina gambar. Ieu nyatakeun yén ieu tempat anu pang alusna pikeun subjek utama nyaéta dina persimpangan garis anu ngabagi gambar kana tilu bagian vertikal sareng horisontal (tingali conto).
mt: A simple guideline for maintaining proportions in a drawing is to place the subject at the intersection of the vertical and horizontal lines (see example).
ref: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image. It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).

src: Misalna, format fotografi umum pisan di dunya nyaeta anu ukuranna 35 mm. Iyeu ngarupakeun ukuran film anu dominan mirip pisan jeung era film analog. Ieu masih didamel nepikeun ayeuna, nanging nu pangpentingna aspek rasiona tos diwariskeun ti format sensor gambar kamera digital. Format 35mm teh saleresna, rada ngabingungkeun, kusabab legana 36mm jangkungna 24mm . Aspek rasio ti bentuk ieu (dibagi dua belas méh kéngéng rasio bilangan buled nu paling sederhana) nyaéta cenah mah 3:2. Loba format umum (format APS jeung babaturan misalna) sarua atawa mirip jeung aspek rasio iyeu.
mt: 35mm is a common format in the world, which is the size of the film that is dominant similar to the era of analog film. This is still made until now, but the most important aspect of the ratio is preserved from the format of the digital camera image sensor. The 35mm format is somewhat confusing, because its length is 36mm and its width is 24mm. The aspect ratio of this form (divided by twelve about the ratio of the simplest number) is about 3:2. Many common formats (APS and related formats, for example) are the same or similar to this aspect ratio.
ref: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era. It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats. The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height. The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2. Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.

src: Kalemahan lensa zum téh nyaéta rumitna pokus sareng sajumlah unsur lensa anu dibutuhkeun pikeun nepi ka rentang panjang pokusna jauh leuwih ageung tibatan lensa nu utama. Ieu ngurangan masalah sabab produsén lénsa ngahontal standar anu langkung dina produksi lénsa. Ieu nu ngamungkinkeun lénsa zoom ngahasilkeun gambar anu kualitas na setanding sareng lénsa panjang fokus tetap. Kakurangan lainna tinu lensa zoom nyaeta bukaan maksimum (kecepatanna) lensa na kadang langkung rendah. Ieu nu matak nyieun lensa jauh mirah sesah dianggo di tempat nu poék tanpa cahaya tambihan.
mt: The difficulty of zoom lenses is the complexity of the focus and the number of lens elements required to achieve a much longer focal length than the main lens. This reduces the problem because lens manufacturers meet standards in lens production. This allows zoom lenses to produce images of equal quality to fixed focal length lenses. Other drawbacks of zoom lenses are the maximum aperture (speed) of the lens which is sometimes lower. This makes the lens less suitable for use in bright places without additional lighting.
ref: The disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the focal complexity and number of lens elements required to achieve a range of focal lengths is much greater than for prime lenses. This is becoming less of an issue as lens manufacturers achieve higher standards in lens production. This has allowed zoom lenses to produce pictures of a quality comparable to that achieved by lenses with fixed focal length. Another disadvantage of zoom lenses is that the maximum aperture (the speed) of the lens is usually lower. This makes inexpensive zoom lenses hard to use in low-light conditions without a flash.

src: Mistik nyaéta ngausahakeun parsekutuan, identitas, atawa kasadaran kana kanyataan anu luhur, kailahian, kabebeneran spiritual, atawa Gusti. Anu pangagem milarian pangalaman, intuisi, atanapi wawasan anu langsung kana kanyataan ketuhanan/hiji dewa atanapi para dewa. Pengikut hoyong ngajalanan hirupna ku cara tertentu, atanapi praktek anu dimaksudkeun pikeun miara pangalaman éta. kayakinan mistis bisa dibedakeun tinu kayakinan agama sejen ku cara nekenkeun tina pangalaman langsung anu sifatna pribadi tur kaayaan sadar, khsusna dina hal kawilujengan, wawasan nu luas tur kabungahan.
mt: Mysticism is the attempt to understand, identify, or become directly acquainted with some reality transcending the powers of the human reason. The experience of mystics is often described in terms of being in direct contact with an ultimate good, perpetual life, or God. Mystical practices are often intended to facilitate such experiences. Mystical beliefs can be distinguished from religious beliefs in general by emphasizing direct personal experience, rather than faith, reason, or revelation.
ref: Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God. The believer seeks a direct experience, intuition, or insight into divine reality/the deity or dieties. Followers pursue certain ways of living, or practices that are intended to nurture those experiences. Mysticism can be distinguished from other forms of religious belief and worship by its emphasis on the direct personal experience of a unique state of consciousness, particularly those of a peaceful, insightful, blissful, or even ecstatic character.

src: Kanggo waktos anu lami dina abad ka salapan belas sareng abad ka dua puluhan, dipercaya yén nunyicingan kahiji di New Zealand nyaéta balaréa Maori, anu ngabujeng manuk raksasa anu namina moa. Téori ieu netepkeun ideu bahwasana urang Maori hijrah ti Polinésia dina Great Fleet sareng nyandak Selandia Anyar ti Moriori, ngabentuk masarakat pertanian. Kumaha wae ge, bukti anyar nunjukeun yén Moriori téh nyaéta kelompok ti daratan Maori anu ngalih ti Selandia Baru ka Kepuloan Chatham, ngembangkeun budaya anjeunna nu khas sareng damai. Aya ogé suku anu lian di Pulo Chatham nyaéta Maori anu ngalih ti Selandia Baru. Maranehna nyarebutkeun manehna sorangan Moriori, terus kajadian babaraha pertempuran leutik jeung akhirna Moriori punah.
mt: For much of the 18th and 19th centuries, it was believed that the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori, who built giant moa birds. This theory held that the Maori migrated from Polynesia in the Great Fleet and settled New Zealand from Moriori, forming a farming society. How ever, new evidence shows that Moriori were a land-based Maori group who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own unique and peaceful culture. There were also other tribes on the Chatham Islands who were Maori who migrated from New Zealand. They then fought and eventually the Moriori were wiped out.
ref: For a long time during the nineteenth and twentieth centuries, it was believed the first inhabitants of New Zealand were the Maori people, who hunted giant birds called moas. The theory then established the idea that the Maori people migrated from Polynesia in a Great Fleet and took New Zealand from the Moriori, establishing an agricultural society. However, new evidence suggests that the Moriori were a group of mainland Maori who migrated from New Zealand to the Chatham Islands, developing their own distinctive, peaceful culture. There was also another tribe on the Chatham islands these were Maori who migrated away from New Zealand. They called themselves the Moriori there were a few skirmishes and in the end, the Moriori were wiped out

src: pureland Origami nyaéta origami jeung batasan yén hiji lipetan nu tiasa dilakukeun dina hiji waktos, lipetan anu langkung rumit sapertos tilep kabalik tiasa dilakukeun, sareng sadaya lipetan gaduh tempat anu lowong. Ieu téh dikembangkeun ku John Smith dina taun 1970an pikeun ngabantos tukang lipet nu teu gaduh pangalaman atawa ngabantos anu kamampuan motorikna terbatas.
mt: pureland Origami is origami with the restriction that a fold may be performed in a given time, folds more complex than a tile may be performed, and all folds have empty space. This was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help novices or those with limited motor skills.
ref: Pureland origami is origami with the restriction that only one fold may be done at a time, more complex folds like reverse folds are not allowed, and all folds have straightforward locations. It was developed by John Smith in the 1970s to help inexperienced folders or those with limited motor skills.

src: Peradaban Landeuh Indus mangrupikeun peradaban Jaman Parunggu di kulon lautna anak buana India anu ngacakup sabagian ageung Pakistan sareng sababaraha daérah di kulon lautna India sareng wétan lautna Afganistan. Peradaban ieu berkembang pesat di kewung Walungan Indus anu timana namina dikéngéngkeun. Sanaos sababaraha sarjana berspekulasi yen margi peradaban oge aya di cekungan Walungan Sarasvati anu ayeuna tuus, eta kedah pas disebut Peradaban Indus-Sarasvati, samentara sababaraha nyebutkeun na Peradaban Harappan sanggeus Harappa, anu kahiji ti loka na anu bade dikali dina 1920-an.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in South Asia, dating from the Chalcolithic period (3300–1300 BCE). It developed in the Balochistan and Punjab regions of Pakistan and in the Sindh and Gujarat regions of India. The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, along with Ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia. It is also called the Harappan Civilization after the type site of Harappa, the first of its sites to be recognized and understood. The Indus Valley Civilization was a highly developed civilization, with large well planned cities, advanced drainage systems, and well laid out roads. The Indus Valley Civilization was also one of the first civilizations to have a writing system, although it is not yet fully understood. ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Peradaban Landeuh Indus mangrupikeun peradaban Jaman Parunggu di kulon lautna anak buana India anu ngacakup sabagian ageung Pakistan sareng sababaraha daérah di kulon lautna India sareng wétan lautna Afganistan. Peradaban ieu berkembang pesat di kewung Walungan Indus anu timana namina dikéngéngkeun. Sanaos sababaraha sarjana berspekulasi yen margi peradaban oge aya di cekungan Walungan Sarasvati anu ayeuna tuus, eta kedah pas disebut Peradaban Indus-Sarasvati, samentara sababaraha nyebutkeun na Peradaban Harappan sanggeus Harappa, anu kahiji ti loka na anu bade dikali dina 1920-an.
mt: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilization in South Asia, dating from the Chalcolithic period (3300–1300 BCE). It developed in the Balochistan and Punjab regions of Pakistan and in the Sindh and Gujarat regions of India. The Indus Valley Civilization was one of the largest early urban civilizations, along with Ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia. It is also called the Harappan Civilization after the type site of Harappa, the first of its sites to be recognized and understood. The Indus Valley Civilization was a highly developed civilization, with large well planned cities, advanced drainage systems, and well laid out roads. The Indus Valley Civilization was also one of the first civilizations to have a writing system, although it is not yet fully understood. ref: The Indus Valley Civilization was a Bronze Age civilisation in the northwest Indian subcontinent encompassing most of modern-day Pakistan and some regions in northwest India and northeast Afghanistan. The civilisation flourished in the basins of the Indus River wherefore it derives its name. Although some scholars speculate that since the civilisation also existed in the basins of the now dried up Sarasvati River, it should be aptly called the Indus-Sarasvati Civilization, while some call it the Harappan Civilization after Harappa, the first of its sites to be excavated in the 1920s.

src: Kasarakahan sareng kaégoisan bakal salawasna aya di urang sareng éta mangrupikeun sifat kerja sama yén nalika mayoritas diuntungkeun bakal aya terus kauntungan anu di waktos nu singkat upami ngalakukeun hal égois. Semoga sabagian gede jelema nyaladar margi pilihan jangka panyang pangalusna nyaeta gawe bareng jeung batur.
mt: Cooperation and selflessness will always be in us and this is the nature of cooperation when the majority will benefit there will always be a benefit in a short time if we do something selfish. I hope most people will choose the longest path of the best choice is to work together and with others.
ref: Greed and selfishness will always be with us and it is the nature of cooperation that when the majority benefit there will always be more to gain in the short term by acting selfishly Hopefully, most people will realise that their long term best option is to work together with others.

src: Beaya perang imperialisme AS pas naklukeun Filipina téh dibayar ku warga Filipina sorangan. Aranjeunna dipaksa kedah mayar pajeug ka rezim kolonial A.S pikeun ngabiayaan sabagian ageung pangeluaran sareng bunga obligasi anu ngambang di luhur nami pamaréntah Filipina liwat bank-bank di Wall Street. Tangtosna, kauntungan super anu diturunkeun tina eksploitasi rakyat Filipina anu kapapanjangan bakal janten kauntungan dasar pikeun imperialisme Amerika Serikat.
mt: The cost of American imperialism in the Philippines was paid by the Filipino people themselves. They were forced to pay interest on the huge loans and interest on the bonds floating above the name of the Philippine government through banks in Wall Street. In fact, the super profits derived from the long-term exploitation of the Filipino people will become the basic profits for American imperialism.
ref: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves. They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses. Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.

src: Pikeun ngartos Templars, kedah ngartos heula kontéks anu ngadukung nyptakeun ordo eta. Mangsa kajadian-kajadian ieu biasana disebut  Abad Pertengahan Luhur, jaman sajarah Éropa dina abad ka-11, ka-12, sareng ka-13 (1000–1300 Masehi). Abad Patengahan Luhur ditiheulaan ku Abad Patengahan Awal jeung diteruskeun ku Abad Patengahan Akhir, anu dumasar ka nganyahokeun réngsé sakitar taun 1500.
mt: To understand the Templars, one must first understand the context that supported their order. The time period in which these events occurred is often referred to as the High Middle Ages, the historical period of Europe in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (1000–1300 AD). The High Middle Ages are preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which is based on the end of the Renaissance around 1500.
ref: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order. The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300). The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.

src: Alam militer karajaan Romawi ngabantos perkembangan kamajuan medis. Para dokter mimiti direkrut ku Kaisar Augustus sareng ngadamel Unit Medis Romawi anu mimiti pikeun ngabantu saatos paperangan. Ahli bedah boga pangaweruh ngeunaan rupa-rupa ubar penenang kaasup morfin tina sasari siki poppy jeung skopolamin tina siki herbana. Aranjeunna janten ahli dina amputasi keur nyalametkeun pasién tina gangren jeung turniket jeung jepitan artéri keur ngeureunkeun aliran getih. Pikeun sababaraha abad, karajaan Romawi kéngéng seueur kauntungan dibidang medis sareng nu masihan seueur elmu nu urang terang jaman ayeuna.
mt: The Roman military contributed to medical development. The first doctors were recruited by Emperor Augustus and formed the Roman Medical Unit, which was initially for battlefield aid. Surgeons had knowledge of various painkillers including morphine from poppy seeds and scopolamine from the herb henbane. They became experts in amputation to save patients from gangrene and tourniquets and artery clamps to stop blood flow. For several centuries, the Roman Empire benefited greatly in the medical field and passed on much knowledge that we still use today.
ref: The militaristic nature of the Roman empire aided in the development of medical advances. Doctors began to be recruited by Emperor Augustus and even formed the first Roman Medical Corps for use in the aftermath of battles. Surgeons had knowledge of various sedatives including morphine from extracts of poppy seeds and scopolamine from herbane seeds. They became proficient at amputation to save patients from gangrene as well as tourniquets and arterial clamps to stem blood flow. Over multiple centuries, the Roman empire led to great gains in the field of medicine and formed much of the knowledge we know today.

src: Visi, atawa kemampuan ninggali gumantung kana sistem organ indrawi visual atawa mata. Aya rupi-rupi bentuk soca, kompléksna dumasar kana kabutuhan makhlukna. Konstruksi anu béda gaduh kamampuan anu béda, sénsitip kana panjang gelombang anu béda sareng ngagaduhan tingkat seukeutna anu beda ogé, teras butuh pangolahan anu béda ogé pikeun supados ngartos input sareng nomer anu béda pikeun digawé sacara optimal.
mt: Vision, or the ability to see, depends on the visual system or eyes. There are many forms, complex based on their needs. Different constructions have different abilities, sensitive to different wavelengths and also have different levels of acuity, then also need different processing so that the input and different numbers can be made optimal.
ref: Vision, or the ability to see depends on visual system sensory organs or eyes. There are many different constructions of eyes, ranging in complexity depending on the requirements of the organism. The different constructions have different capabilities, are sensitive to different wave-lengths and have differing degrees of acuity, also they require different processing to make sense of the input and different numbers to work optimally.

src: "Sikhisme nyaeta ageman ti anak benua India. Eta asalna di wilayah Punjab salami abad ka-15 ti perpecahan sektarian dina talari Hindu. Sikh nganggap kapercayaanana mangrupikeun agama anu béda tina Hindu sanaos aranjeunna ngaku asal sareng tradisina ti Hindu. Urang Sikh nyebatkeun agamana Gurmat, anu dina basa Punjabi hartosna ""cara guru"". Guru mangrupiken aspek anu mendasar tina sadaya agama India tapi Sikhisme dianggapna penting anu ngawangun inti tina kapercayaan Sikh. Agama ieu diadegkeun dina abad ka-15 ku Guru Nanak (1469-1539). Saterasna aya salapan guru sanés anu ngiringan."
mt: "Sikhism is a religion of the Indian subcontinent. It originated in the Punjab region in the fifteenth century as a reaction to the caste system of Hinduism. Sikhs regard their faith as a distinct religion separate from Hinduism, although they acknowledge their origins and traditions as Hindu. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which in Punjabi means "the way of the Guru". The Guru is a central aspect of all Indian religions but Sikhism is considered to be the most important of these. The religion was founded in the fifteenth century by Guru Nanak (1469-1539). There were nine other gurus after him."
ref: "Sikhism is a religion from the Indian sub-continent. It originated in the Punjab region during the 15th century from a sectarian split within the Hindu tradition. Sikhs consider their faith to be a separate religion from Hinduism though they acknowledge its Hindu roots and traditions. Sikhs call their religion Gurmat, which is Punjabi for ""way of the guru"". The guru is a fundamental aspect of all Indian religions but in Sikhism has taken on an importance that forms the core of Sikh beliefs. The religion was founded in the 15th century by Guru Nanak (1469–1539). There followed in succession a further nine gurus."

src: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""nya éta kelainan dina sistim saraf nu biasana aya ciri-cirina, nya éta dorongan nu kiat, gampil kaganggu, sareng aktif pisan atanapi seueur teuing tenaga"". Ieu sanés teu wasa diajar, ieu mangrupikeun gangguan diajar; ieu ""mangaruhan 3 dugi ka 5 persén murangkalih, mereun aya sakitar 2 juta murangkalih di Amérika"". barudak kalawan ADD ngalaman kahese kanggo fokus dina perkawis-perkawis sepertos pagawean sakola,nanging maranehanana tiasa konsentrasi dina perkawis-perkawis anu maranehanana sukai sepertos ulin game atawa nongton kartun favorit maranehanana atawa nyerat kalimah tanpa tawis maos. Barudak ieu condong ngalaman seueur masalah, sabab ""kalibet dina perilaku anu berisiko, gelut, sareng nangtang aparat"" pikeun ngarangsang otak, sabab otak aranjeunna teu tiasa dirangsang ku cara anu biasa. ADD mangaruhan hubungan sareng babaturan anu sanés kusabab budak anu sanés henteu ngartos naha aranjeunna sapertos kitu atanapi kunaon aranjeunna ngeja sapertos aranjeunna dilakukeun atanapi tingkat kematanganana béda."
mt: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a disorder of the nervous system that is usually characterized by hyperactivity, distractibility, and impulsivity"". This is not a learning disability, this is a learning disorder; this ""affects 3 to 5 percent of school-age children, or about 2 million children in the United States"". Children with ADD have difficulty focusing on tasks such as schoolwork, but they can concentrate on tasks they enjoy such as playing video games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing without stopping. These children tend to have more problems, because ""behavioral problems, fighting, and running away"" to stimulate the brain, because their brains can not be stimulated by normal means. ADD affects relationships with others because other children do not understand why they are like that or why they write like they are doing or their level of maturity is different."
ref: "Attention Deficit Disorder ""is a neurological syndrome whose classic defining triad of symptoms including impulsivity, distractibility, and hyperactivity or excess energy"". It is not a learning disability, it is a learning disorder; it ""affects 3 to 5 percent of all children, perhaps as many as 2 million American children"". Children with ADD have a hard time focusing on things like school work, but they can concentrate on things they enjoy doing like playing games or watching their favorite cartoons or writing sentences without punctuation. These children tend to get into a lot of trouble, because they ""engage in risky behaviors, get into fights, and challenge authority"" in order to stimulate their brain, since their brain can not be stimulated by normal methods. ADD affects relationships with other peers because other children can not understand why they act the way that they do or why they spell they way they do or that their maturity level is different."

src: Upami diajar anu dumasar proyék kedahna ngajantenkeun diajar langkung gampil sareng menarik, ngabangun perancah langkung maju deui. Scaffolding sanés mangrupakeun metode diajar tapi mangrupakeun bantuan anu nyayogikeun dukungan kanggo individu anu keur ngalaman pengalaman anyar siga ngagunakeun program komputer anu anyar atawa ngamimitian proyek anyar. Rangka tiasa berbentuk virtual atanapi nyata, guru mangrupikeun bentuk rangka tapi sami ogé penjepit kertas alit nu aya di Microsoft Office. Perancah Maya diinternalisasikeun dina perangkat lunak sareng dimaksudkeun pikeun naroskeun, nyuhungkeun, sareng ngajelaskeun prosedur anu hésé pikeun murid upami dikerjakeun ku nyalira.
mt: If instruction is based on project-based learning, scaffolding can make instruction easier and more engaging. Scaffolding is not instruction but support for individuals experiencing new experiences such as using a new computer program or starting a new project. It can be virtual or physical, a teacher is a form of scaffolding but also a small paper clip that is in Microsoft Office. Maya scaffolding is internalized in software and intended to guide, support, and explain procedures for students if done by reading.
ref: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond. Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project. Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office. Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.

src: MySpace nyaéta halaman web paling populér katilu anu dianggo di Amerika Serikat sareng jumlah profilna ayeuna aya 54 juta. Situs-situs ieu tos narik seueur perhatian, utamana di bidang atikan. Aya sababaraha aspek positif tina eta  halaman web, nyaeta, jadi gampang ngatur halaman kelas nu tiasa kaasup blog, video, foto, jeung fitur nu lian na. Kaca ieu tiasa gampang diakses ku ngan ukur nyayogikeun 1 alamat wéb, anu matak émut teras gampang diketik kanggo murid anu panginten kasusah ngagunakeun keyboard atanapi nganggo ejaan. Eta tiasa di disaluyukeun meh leuwih gampang dibaca jeung sakalian kirang atanapi langkung dina warnana sakumaha nu di arepkeun.
mt: MySpace is the third most popular website in the United States and has 54 million profiles. These sites have attracted a lot of attention, especially in the field of education. There are several positive aspects of this web page, namely, it is easy to arrange the classroom pages that can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features on. This page can be easily accessed by simply typing in one web address, which makes it easy for students who are difficult to use the keyboard or using spelling. This can be easily read and more or less in color as intended.
ref: MySpace is the third most popular website used in the United States and has 54 million profiles currently. These websites have gotten a lot of attention, especially in the education setting. There are positive aspects to these websites, which include, being able to easily setup a class page which can include blogs, videos, photos, and other features. This page can easily be accessed by providing just one web address, which makes it easy to remember and easy to type in for students who may have trouble using the keyboard or with spelling. It can be customized to make it easy to read and also with as much or little color as desired.

src: nanging, dina sasih Juni taun 1956, jangji na Krushchev teh meunang cocoba nalika aya kajadian karusuhan di Polandia, nalika pagawe protes ngeunaan kakurangan dahareun jeung pangurangan gajih, harita protest eta teh robah jadi protes kana sistim komunis Sanaos akhirna mah, Krushchev ngirim teng baja kanggo nentramkeun, anjeunna ngirim tuntutan ékonomi sareng satuju nunjuk Wladyslaw Gomulka janten pardana menteri nu enggal.
mt: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when there was a riot in Poland, when food protests over shortages and wage cuts turned into protests against the communist system. Finally, Krushchev sent in troops to quell the unrest, and he made economic concessions and agreed to appoint Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.
ref: However, in June 1956, Krushchev's promises were put to the test when riots in Poland, where workers were protesting against food shortages and wage cuts, turned into a general protest against Communism. Although in the end, Krushchev sent in tanks to restore order, he did give way to some economic demands and agreed to appoint the popular Wladyslaw Gomulka as the new prime minister.

src: Jerman mangrupikeun musuh umum dina Perang Dunya 2, anu nuju damel kerjasama antara Uni Soviet sareng AS. Kalayan tungtung perang pasea sistem, proses sareng budaya ngabalukarkeun nagara-nagara murag. Kalayan dua taun ti ahir perang, mantan sekutu ayeuna janten musuh teras Perang Dingin dimimitian. Éta diharapkeun bertahan salami 40 taun ka payun sareng bakal diperjuangkeun sacara nyata, ku pasukan proksi, di medan perang ti Afrika dugi ka Asia, di Apganistan, Kuba sareng seueur tempat sanés.
mt: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, which led to the alliance between the Soviet Union and the United States. With the end of the war, the process and culture of the defeated countries led to the two former allies becoming enemies in the Cold War. This was expected to last for 40 years and was fought in reality, by proxy forces, in the battlefield from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
ref: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out. With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began. It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.

src: Sistem saraf ngajaga homeostasis ku ngirim dorongan saraf ka sakabeh awak pikeun ngajaga getih lancar sareng teu diganggu. Dorongan-dorongan saraf ieu tiasa dikirimkeun kalawan enggal ka sadaya salira, ieu ngajagi salira supados aman ti sagala anceman.
mt: The nervous system maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses to all parts of the body to keep the blood flowing and unobstructed. These nerve impulses can be sent to all organs, making them safe from all dangers.
ref: The Nervous System maintains homeostasis by sending nerve impulses through out the body to keep the flow of blood going as well as undisturbed. These nerve impulses can be sent so quickly throughout the body which helps keep the body safe from any potential threat.

src: "Piramida Ageung di Giza nyaeta hiji-hijina tina 7 kaajaiban anu masih jumeneng ayeuna. Diwangun ku urang Mesir di abad katilu SM, Piramida Agung nyaéta salah sahiji tina réa deui wangunan piramida ageung anu kantos diwangun pikeun ngahormatan Firaun anu maot. Taneuh datar Giza, atau nu disebat ""Giza Necropolis"" anu aya di jero Gawir Mayat Mesir teh loba di eusi ku piramid (anu mana pirawid the great téh nyaéta pang badagna) batu-batu nisan anu laleutik, kuil-kuil, jeung Sphinx. Piramida ageung didamel pikeun ngahargaan ka Firaun Khufu, sareng seueur piramida nu langkung alit, makam sareng candi nu didamel pikeun ngahargaan pamajikan Khufu sareng anggota kulawarga na."
mt: "The Great Pyramid of Giza is one of the seven wonders of the ancient world. Built by the Egyptians in the third millennium BC, the Great Pyramid is one of several large pyramids built to honor the Pharaoh who died. The flat land of Giza, or the "Giza Necropolis" is full of pyramids (and the great one is the largest) tombs, temples, and the Sphinx. The Great Pyramid was built to honor Pharaoh Khufu, and several smaller pyramids, tombs and temples were built to honor Khufu's wife and family members."
ref: "The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today. Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh. The Giza Plateau, or ""Giza Necropolis"" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx. The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members."

src: Kuil Artemis di Ephesus diancurkeun kaping 21 Juli, 356 SM ku aksi pembakaran nu dilakukeun ku Herostratus. Numutkeun carita, motivasina nyaéta kasohor ku cara naon waé. Urang Efesus, babari ambek, ngumumkeun yén nami Herostratus henteu partos dicatet. Sejarawan Yunani satuluyna nyatet ngaranna sapertos anu urang nyaho ayeuna. Kuil dihancurkeun di peuting Aleksander Agung dilahirkeun. Alexander, salaku raja, nawarkeun diri mayar kanggo ngawangun kuil deui, tapi tawaranna ditampik. Teras, saatos Alexander maot, kuilna diwangun deui dina 323 BCE.
mt: 21 July, 356 BC, the Temple of Artemis in Ephesus was flooded by a burning action carried out by Herostratus. According to legend, his motive was to become famous by any means. The Ephesians, in their anger, decreed that the name of Herostratus should never be recorded. Later Greek historians recorded his name as we know it today. The temple was destroyed at night Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay for the reconstruction of the temple, but his offer was rejected. Later, after Alexander's death, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BC.
ref: The temple of Artemis at Ephesus was destroyed on July 21, 356 BCE in an act of arson committed by Herostratus. According to the story, his motivation was fame at any cost. The Ephesians, outraged, announced that Herostratus' name never be recorded. The Greek historian Strabo later noted the name, which is how we know today. The temple was destroyed on the same night that Alexander the Great was born. Alexander, as king, offered to pay to rebuild the temple, but his offer was denied. Later, after Alexander died, the temple was rebuilt in 323 BCE.

src: Transportasi kahiji anu dipikanyaho nyaeta mapah, jalmi mimiti mapah ajeg 2 juta warsih anu kaliwat kalawan medalna Homo Erectus (hartina jalmi anu ajeg lempeng). Pendahuluna, Australopithecus henteu lempang lempeng sakumaha anu biasana. Spésialisasi dua suku atos ditemukeun dina fosil Australopithecus ramo 4.2-3.9 juta taun ka tukang, sanaos Sahelanthropus manawi atos mapan kalawan 2 suku saprak mimiti dina 7 juta taun katukang.
mt: The first known map was a mapah, the first mapah was 2 million years old when Homo Erectus (meaning upright man) appeared. Its predecessor, Australopithecus, was not upright like most people. The specialization of two toes was found in the fossil Australopithecus ramo 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus had two toes since the beginning 7 million years ago.
ref: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man). Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually. Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.

src: Nganggo kapal pikeun ngangkut barang salami ieu mangrupikeun cara anu paling éfisién pikeun mindahkeun seueur jalma sareng barang meuntas lautan. Pancén soldadu angkatan laut utamina nyaéta kanggo mastikeun nagara mertahankeun kamampuan pikeun mindahkeun balaréa sarta barang-barang, samentara dina waktos anu sami, kedah ngaganggu kamampuan batur mindahkeun balaréa sarta barang-barangna. Salah sahiji conto penting kanggo diemut nyaéta kampanyé Atlantik Kalér ngeunaan Perang Dunia II. Urang Amérika nyoba mindahkeun jalmi jeung barang ngaléwatan samudera Atlantik kanggo nulungan Inggris. Di waktos nu sami, pasukan laut Jerman, seringna make U-boats, keur nyetop kamacétan ieu. Seandaina sekutu gagal, Jérman tiasa waé bakal naklukkeun Inggris sapertos naklukkeun sakumna Éropa.
mt: Using ships to transport goods is the most efficient way to move large numbers of people and goods across oceans. The primary purpose of naval soldiers is to maintain the ability to transport troops and goods, while at the same time, the ability to transport troops and goods is disrupted. One important example is the North Atlantic campaign during World War II. The Americans tried to transport people and goods across the Atlantic Ocean to help the British. At the same time, the German navy, often using U-boats, tried to stop this traffic. If the allies failed, Germany could easily conquer Britain as it conquered all of Europe.
ref: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans. The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods. One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain. At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic. Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.

src: Penemuan kikiping anu nganggo jari-jari midamel kareta Asyur langkung hampang, langkung enggal, sarta langkung siap kanggo lumpat langkung enggal ti tentara sarta kareta lianna. Panah-panah nu dongkap dina pamanah téh tiasa nembus acuk zirah prajurit. Pas taun 1000 saacan maséhi, suku Assyrians ngenalkeun pasukan kuda nu kahiji. Pasukan kuda mangrupiken pasukan anu perang dina kuda. Pelana teu acan kapendak, janten pasukan kuda Assyrian perang dina tonggong kuda tanpa alat nanaon.
mt: 1000 years before the birth of Christ, the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. Cavalry is a military unit that fights on horseback. The riders were not equipped with armor, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the horse's neck without armor.
ref: The invention of spoke wheels made Assyrian chariots lighter, faster, and better prepared to outrun soldiers and other chariots. Arrows from their deadly crossbows could penetrate the armor of rival soldiers. About 1000 B.C., the Assyrians introduced the first cavalry. A cavalry is an army that fights on horseback. The saddle had not yet been invented, so the Assyrian cavalry fought on the bare backs of their horses.

src: Urang Babilon ngawangun kuil utama pikeun masing-masing déwa sareng dianggap imahna dewa. Jalma-jalma bakal nawiskeun pangorbanan ka déwa sareng pendeta bakal ngusahakeun nyumponan kabutuh para déwa lewat upacara sareng festival. Setiap kuil kagungan halaman kuil anu terbuka teras tempat panangtayungan anu ngan para imam anu tiasa asup. Kadang babaraha menara anu gaduh wujud sapertos piramid, disebut ziggurat. Ziggurat diwangun salaku bagian tina kuil. Puncak menarana nyaeta tempat istimewa pikeun Tuhan.
mt: Babylonians built a main temple for each god and considered it his home. People would sacrifice to the gods and priests would try to satisfy the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had a courtyard open to the public and only priests could enter. Sometimes towers with a shape like a pyramid, called ziggurats, were part of the temple. Ziggurats were built as part of the temple. The top of the tower was a special place for God.
ref: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god. People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals. Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter. Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples. The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.

src: "Leres! Raja Tutankhamun, anu sakapeung disebut ""Raja Tut"" atawa ""Raja Muda"", nyaeta salah sahiji Raja Mesir kuno anu dikenal pisan di zaman modern. Unikna, anjeunna henteu dianggep penting pisan di jaman harita teras henteu dicatet dina daptar raja-raja jaman baheula. Nanging, papanggihan makamna di 1922 ngajantenkeun anjeunna jadi selebritis, nalika seeur makam kapungkur dijarah, makam anjeunna diantep teu kaganggu. Seeurna barang anu kakubur sareng Tutankhamun téh parantos dilestarikeun, kalebet  ogé rébuan paninggalan anu dijieun tina logam mulia sareng batu langka."
mt: "Tut! King Tutankhamun, who was once known as "King Tut" or "Young King," was one of the most famous ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Uniquely, he was not considered very important at the time and was not recorded in the list of ancient kings. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity, when the last tomb was looted, his tomb was not disturbed. His tomb's contents were still preserved, including thousands of treasures made of precious metals and rare stones."
ref: "Yes! King Tutankhamun, sometimes referred to as ""King Tut"" or ""The Boy King"", is one of the most well known ancient Egyptian kings in modern times. Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

Interestingly, he was not considered to be very important in ancient times and was not recorded on most ancient king lists. However, the discovery of his tomb in 1922 made him a celebrity. While many tombs of the past were robbed, this tomb was left virtually undisturbed. Most of the items buried with Tutankhamun have been well preserved, including thousands of artefacts made from precious metals and rare stones."

src: Urang sadayana terang seueur politisi, élmuwan, sareng seniman Yunani. Jigana anu paling kasohor dina budaya ieu nyaéta Homer, penyair buta anu kasohor pisan, anu ngadamel dua mahakarya sastra Yunani: puisi Iliad sareng Odyssey. Sophocles sareng Aristophanes masih jadi panulis naskah populér sareng lakonana dianggap karya sastra pangpentingna di dunya. Jalmi Yunani séjén anu kawéntar nyaéta matematikawan Phythagoras, paling ka sohor ku teori na anu kawéntar ngeunaan sisi sagitiga katuhu.
mt: We all know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. The most famous in this culture is Homer, the blind poet who is very famous, who made two Greek literary works: the Iliad and the Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered the most important literary works in the world. Other famous Greeks include mathematician Phythagoras, most famous for his theory of the Pythagorean theorem.
ref: We know many Greek politicians, scientists, and artists. Possibly the most known person of this culture is Homer, the legendary blind poet, who composed two masterpieces of Greek literature: the poems Iliad and Odyssey. Sophocles and Aristophanes are still popular playwrights and their plays are considered to be among the greatest works of world literature. Another famous Greek is a mathematician Pythagoras, mostly known for his famous theorem about relations of the sides of right triangles.

src: Dina iklim haneut dina Timur Tengah, Imah henteu pati penting pikeun aranjeunna. Lolobana kahirupan ti kulawarga Ibrani kajadian dina rohangan terbuka. Istri masakna di halaman; toko-toko ngan saukur konter anu malik ka jalan. Batu dianggo pikeun ngawangun imah. Tiheulana heunteu aya hutan lega di tanah Kanaan, jadi harga kayu mahal pisan.
mt: In the dry climate of the Middle East, a house is not very important to them. Most of the life of the Hebrew family takes place outdoors. The wife cooks in the courtyard; shops are only counters that open onto the street. Stone is used to build houses. In the past there were not many large forests in the land of Canaan, so the price of wood was very high.
ref: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important. Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air. Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses. There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
