src: Greenland tara aya anu nempatan. Dina carita Nordik aranjeunna ngadongeng yén Erik si Beureum diasingkeun ti Islandia kusabab ngabunuh, teras nalika ngumbara ka kulon, mendakan Greenland teras masihan nami Greenland. Tapi salian ti panimuan anjeuna, suku éskimo téh emang tos netep dina eta tempat ti jaman harita. Sanaos unggal nagara eta 'Skandinavia', aya seueur bedana antara masarakat, raja, adat istiadat sareng sajarah ti Denmark, Swedia, Norwegia Sareng Islandia.
mt: Greenland is not uninhabited. In Norse mythology, they tell of how Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland because he killed, then when he traveled west, discovered Greenland, then named it Greenland. But aside from their discovery, the Inuit people have lived there since ancient times.  Despite being part of "Scandinavia", there are many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Sanaos seuseueurna tuangeun aranjeunna dalit pikeun urang, urang Romawi gaduh tuangeun di hajatan anu anéh atanapi henteu biasa, kalebet bagong, merak, kéong, sareng sato nu ngerat anu di sebat beurit. Beda sanesna nalika nyaeta jalma-jalma miskin sareng awewe tuang bari diuk dina korsi, anu beunghar resep ngayakeun perjamuan babarengan dina aranjeunna bakal berbaring nalika tuang. Tuangeun Romawi Kuno henteu tiasa ngalebetkeun tuangeun anu dugi ka Éropa ti Amérika atanapi ti Asia di abad-abad saparantosna. Salaku conto, aranjeunna henteu gaduh jagung, tomat, kentang, kalapa, teras teu aya jalmi Romawi kuno anu atos nyobian kalkun.
mt: While the Romans had their own unusual or uncommon, new, exotic, and strange animals at feasts, such as peacocks, cranes, and other beasts of prey. Unlike the poor and the sick who were carried in litters, the rich would be served a banquet together while they reclined. Roman feasts did not include turkeys, tomatoes, potatoes, coconuts, or any other New World or Asian foods. For example, they did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes, coconuts, or any other New World or Asian foods. For example, they did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes, coconuts, or any other New World or Asian foods. For example, they did not have corn, tomatoes, potatoes, coconuts, or any other New World or Asian foods.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Paradaban mangrupikeun budaya anu kagolong kana sakumpulan jalma anu hirup sareng damel sasarengan, masarakat. kecap civilization asalna tina basa Latén nyaéta civilis nu hartina sipil, aya hubungana jeung kecap Latén civis, nu hartina warga nagara, jeung civitas, nu hartina dayeuh atawa dayeuh-nagara bagian, jeung teuing kumaha harti éta téh tiasa dihartikeun sakumaha seueur na eta masarakat nu disajeroeunana. Kota-nagara bagian nyaéta pelopor bangsa. Budaya peradaban nyiratkeun penerusan pangaweryg keur sababaraha generasi,tapak budaya anu tinggaleun sarta penyebaran anu adil. Budaya minor sering binasa tanpa ninggalkeun buktos sajarah anu pakait tur gagal diaku salaku peradaban anu pantes.
mt: A civilization is a complex society consisting of differentiated social classes, advanced urban centers, and a form of government that is usually, although not always, persistent and distinct from its environment. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, which refers to "citizen", "urban", "public", and "social". The related Latin word civitas means "city", "state", "republic", and "citizenship". The term civilization is used in the social sciences and humanities to describe societies that have become more complex in terms of their writing systems, technology, and social and political structures. Civilizations are found on every continent in the world, and have been in existence for thousands of years. The earliest civilizations were located in Mesopotamia, Egypt, and the Indus Valley. The term civilization is also used to describe the process of becoming civilized, which is the process of becoming more complex in terms of writing systems, technology, and social and political structures. ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong nyaeta benteng sareng biara Buddha anu tos rubuh dina bagian luhur Distrik Paro (di Kampung Phondey). Disebatkeun yén di taun 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel midamel bénténg pikeun pangémut kameunanganna ngalawan pasukan Mongol-Tibét. Di taun 1951, kahuruan nyebabkeun ngan nyisakeun sababaraha patilasan Drukgyal Dzong, sapertos gambar Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. Saenggeus kahuruan, bénténg éta diawétkeun jeung dijaga, dugi ka janten salah sahiji anu paling dipikaresepeun di Bhutan.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong was a fortress and Buddhist monastery that was destroyed in the upper Paro district (in Phondey village). It was said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel built the fortress to repel Mongol-Tibetan invaders. In 1951, an earthquake caused only some remnants of Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as a picture of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the earthquake, the fortress was preserved and protected, becoming one of the most visited in Bhutan.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: Salila abad ka-18, Kamboja manggihan anjeunna kacepét di antawis dua tatangga anu kuat, Thailand jeung Vietnam. Urang Thailand narajang Kamboja sababaraha kali di abad ka 18 sareng di taun 1772, aranjeunna ngancurkeun Phnom Phen. Dina taun-taun pangtungtungna abad ka-18, urang Vietnam ogé narajang Kamboja.
mt: 18th century, Cambodia found itself between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais attacked Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772, they destroyed Phnom Penh. In the last years of the 18th century, the Vietnamese also attacked Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Asal muasal Taiwan atos ti saprak abad ka-15 nalika pelaut Éropa ngaliwat tur nyatet nami pulo  éta sabagé Formosa, atanapi pulo anu éndah. Di aun1624, Walanda Hindia ngadegkeun hiji markas di barat daya Taiwan, anu mulai parobahan prakték produksi biji-bijian pribumi sareng ngagawékeun pagawé Tiongkok pikeun damel perkebonan paré sareng gula. dina taun 1683, pasukan dinasti Qing (1644-1912) nyekel wilayah basisir kulon sareng kalér Taiwan sareng nyatakeun yén Taiwan janten salah sahiji provinsi Karajaan Qing di taun 1885. Dina taun 1895, saatos éléh di Perang Sino-Jepang nu mimiti (1894-1895), Pamaréntahan Qing nandatanganan Perjanjian Shimonoseki, anu nyerahkeun kadaulatan Taiwan ka Jepang, nu nguasaan pulau éta nepi ka taun 1945.
mt: Taiwan has been inhabited since the late Paleolithic. The earliest inhabitants known to have been alive on the island at the time of European contact were the aboriginal Taiwanese, whose languages belong to the Austronesian language family (see Taiwanese indigenous peoples). The name "Formosa" for the island is first known to appear on Portuguese maps in the sixteenth century, the name derived from the Portuguese word for "beautiful" (formosa). The name was given by Portuguese sailors who reached the island on April 21, 1542 and noted in their diaries that "this island, which we have named Ilha Formosa, is the most beautiful one that eyes have seen." The earliest inhabitants known to have been alive on the island at the time of European contact were the aboriginal Taiwanese, whose languages belong to the Austronesian language family (see Taiwanese indigenous peoples). The name "Formosa" for the island is first known to appear on Portuguese maps in the sixteenth century, the name derived from the Portuguese word for "beautiful" (formosa). The name was given by Portuguese sailors who reached the island on April 21, 1542 and noted in their diaries that "this island, which we have named Ilha Formosa, is the most beautiful one that eyes have seen." The earliest inhabitants known to have been alive on the island at the time of European contact were the aboriginal Taiwanese, whose languages belong to the Austronesian language family (see Taiwanese indigenous peoples). The name was given by Portuguese sailors who reached the island on April 21, 1542 and noted in their diaries that "this island, which we have named Ilha Formosa, is the most beautiful one that eyes have seen." The earliest inhabitants known to have been alive on the island at the time of European contact were the aboriginal Taiwanese, whose languages belong to the Austronesian language family (see Taiwanese indigenous peoples). The name "Formosa" for the island is first known to appear on Portuguese maps in the sixteenth century, the name derived from the Portuguese word for "beautiful" (formosa). The name was given by Portuguese sailors who reached the island on April 21, 1542 and noted in their diaries that "this island, which we have named Ilha Formosa, is the most beautiful one that eyes have
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Asal muasal Taiwan atos ti saprak abad ka-15 nalika pelaut Éropa ngaliwat tur nyatet nami pulo  éta sabagé Formosa, atanapi pulo anu éndah. Di aun1624, Walanda Hindia ngadegkeun hiji markas di barat daya Taiwan, anu mulai parobahan prakték produksi biji-bijian pribumi sareng ngagawékeun pagawé Tiongkok pikeun damel perkebonan paré sareng gula. dina taun 1683, pasukan dinasti Qing (1644-1912) nyekel wilayah basisir kulon sareng kalér Taiwan sareng nyatakeun yén Taiwan janten salah sahiji provinsi Karajaan Qing di taun 1885. Dina taun 1895, saatos éléh di Perang Sino-Jepang nu mimiti (1894-1895), Pamaréntahan Qing nandatanganan Perjanjian Shimonoseki, anu nyerahkeun kadaulatan Taiwan ka Jepang, nu nguasaan pulau éta nepi ka taun 1945.
mt: Taiwan has been inhabited since the late Paleolithic. The earliest inhabitants known to have been alive on the island at the time of European contact were the aboriginal Taiwanese, whose languages belong to the Austronesian language family (see Taiwanese indigenous peoples). The name "Formosa" for the island is first known to appear on Portuguese maps in the sixteenth century, the name derived from the Portuguese word for "beautiful" (formosa). The name was given by Portuguese sailors who reached the island on April 21, 1542 and noted in their diaries that "this island, which we have named Ilha Formosa, is the most beautiful one that eyes have seen." The earliest inhabitants known to have been alive on the island at the time of European contact were the aboriginal Taiwanese, whose languages belong to the Austronesian language family (see Taiwanese indigenous peoples). ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Ieu disebatna pH kimia. anjeun tiasa ngadamel panunjuk nganggo jus kol beureum. Jus kubis robah warna na gumantung kana sakumaha asam atawa basa (alkaline) bahan kimia na. Kadar pH na ditentukeun ku jumlah ion hidogen (H dina pH) dina bahan kimia anu dites. Ion hydrogén nyaéta proton anu ngaleupaskeun éléktronna (margi atom Hydrogen téh asalnya tina hiji proton jeung hiji éléktron).
mt: This is called chemical pH. You can make a pH indicator using red cabbage juice. Cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical substance is. The pH level is determined by the amount of hydrogen ions (H in pH) in the chemical being tested. Hydrogen ions are protons that release electrons (hydrogen atoms are made up of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Singa nyaéta ucing anu paling resep bersosial, hirup dina kelompok nu gedé nu disebut kabanggaan. Prides terdiri ti hiji nepi ka tilu pejantan dewasa, sareng sakitar tilu puluh bikang sareng budakna. Awéwé biasana gaduh hubungan anu caket sareng anu sanésna, dina wujud kulawargi ageung ti sodara awéwé jeung anak awéwé. Kabanggaan singa teu béda jauh jeung kawanan serigala atawa anjing, sato anu mirip jeung singa (tapi henteu jeung ucing-ucing gedé nu séjén) dina kalakuan, jeung sakitu bahayana keur mangsana.
mt: Lions are social animals, living in large groups called prides. Prides consist of a group of one to three adult males, and about 20 females and their cubs. Females typically have close relationships with those outside their own family, in the form of large extended families of sisters and their daughters. Lion prides are not unlike wolf packs or dog packs, in behavior, and are just as dangerous to prey animals.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Di handapeun éta nyaéta ucing nu ukuranna sedeng anu dahar mangsa ukuran sedeng mulai tina kelinci, antelop, jeung rusa. Akhirna, loba ucing leutik (kaasup ucing piaraan) anu daang leuwih loba sato leutik kos sato gegemetan, beurit, kadal, jeung manuk. Rahasia pikeun kasuksésan aranjeunna nyaéta konsép ceruk, padamelan husus diboga ku ucing méh ngajauhkeun persaingan jeung nu séjén.
mt: Below are examples of small predators that prey on small prey, including small prey such as rabbits, antelopes, and deer. Eventually, many small predators (including domesticated predators) have become more successful in outcompeting other predators. The secret to their success is the concept of niche, a specialized occupation by predators.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Ocelots resep ngamangsa sato nu leutik. Maranéhna bakal ngadahar monyet, oray, sato nu ngégél jeung manuk mun manéhna bisa. Hampir kabéh sato anu dimangsa ku ocelot téh leuwih leutik ti ukuran manéhna. para elmuan nganggap yen ocelot moro sato sejen pikeun didahar teh ku pangangseuna, ngangseu jana taneuh dimana sato sejen eta pernah ngaliwat. Sato éta tiasa ébréh dina poék nganggo panenjo wengi, teras tiasa ogé ongko-ongkoan lalaunan pisan. Ocelot moro mangsana ku nyampur kana sakurilingna teras ngerekeb mangsana.
mt: Ocelots are known to prey on small animals. They will eat monkeys, rabbits, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that an ocelot preys on are smaller than itself. Scientists believe that ocelots are more selective in what they eat than other cats, eating only what they can catch. They are also known to eat their prey in the dark, then bury the remains for later. Ocelots are known to hunt in groups, then share their prey.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: saurang atlet anu elmuan lega, maung anu tiasa memanjat (sanaos henteu sae), ngojay, ngaluncatan jara anu tebih sarta metot kalawan kakiatan jalmi anu kiat 5 kali lipet. Maung teh aya dina jumplukan anu sarua (Genus Panthera) jeung singa, maung belang tutul, jeung jaguar. Opat ucing ieu téh hiji-hijina anu bisa ngagerem. Geurungan maung heunteu okos geurungan singa anu gede tapi leuwih sarua jeung geureungan kalimat anu laun.
mt: A large, agile, carnivorous mammal, able to climb trees, run, swim, leap great distances, and turn quickly. Lions, tigers, leopards, and jaguars are the only four big cats. Lions are not as smart as large elephants, but they are more similar to large elephants than they are to small elephants.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Sél téh nyaéta unit struktural jeung fungsional anu pangleutikna tina organisme kahirupan. Sél asalna tina basa Latin anu hartosna rohang alit. Lamun anjeun ningal mahluk hirup nganggo mikroskop, anjeun bakal ningal yen aranjeunna kasusun tina kotak-kotak atawa bola-bola leutik. Robert Hooke, ahli biologi ti Inggris, ningali kotak alit dina colokanana liwat mikroskop. Maranéhanana katembong siga rohangan-rohangan. Anjeunna téh jalmi kahiji anu nitetan sél nilar.
mt: A cell is the structural and functional unit of an organism. It comes from the Latin word cellula, which literally means small room. When you look at living things with a microscope, you will see that they are made up of little boxes or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small boxes in his glass slides through a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Sato dijieun tina loba sel. Maranéhanana dahar jeung nyerna dina jero awak. Kalolobaan sato tiasa  unggut. Sato hungkul anu gaduh otak (sanajan teu sadayana sato gaduh; ubur-ubur, contona, henteu gaduh otak). Sato kapanggih sakumna dunya. Maranéhanana ngadongkar taneuh, ngojay di sagara, sareng ngalayang di langit.
mt: Organisms are made up of many cells. These cells eat and excrete inside the body. Most organisms have brains (although not all organisms have brains; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Organisms are found all over the world. They live on land, swim in the sea, and fly in the air.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Tutuwuhan ngahasilkeun oksigén anu dihirup ku manusa, sareng manehna nyandak karbon dioksida anu ku manusa kaluarkeun (nyaeta, manusia ngahembuskeun nafasna). Pepelakan ngolah daangeuna jeung bantuan sinar panon poe ngalewatan fotosintesis. Pepelakan oge ngiuhkeun. Urang ngabangun imah jeung ngajait baju tina pepelakan. Hampir kabeh kadaharan nu urang dahar tina pepelakan oge. Mun euweuh pepelakan, sato teu bisa hirup.
mt: Plants produce oxygen that humans breathe, and they take in carbon dioxide that humans exhale (that is, humans breathe out their breath). Plants also absorb water. We build houses and sew clothes from plants. Almost all the food we eat is made from plants. Without plants, animals cannot live.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Nalika sakelompok sakedik mahluk hirup (penduduk leutik) kapisahkeun ti populasi utami ti asal aranjeuna (sapertos pindah ka peuntas gunung atanapi walungan, atanapi upami pindah ka hiji pulo anyar supados henteu gampang balik) aranjeunna bakal sering mendakan diri di lingkunganana bénten ti sateuacan. lingkungan enggal ieu ngagaduhan bahan baku anu beda sareng musuh anu beda, janten populasi anu enggal ngabutuhkeun fitur anu beda atanapi nyesuaikeun kanggo janten saingan anu kuat ti batan anu heubeul Populasi aslina moal ngarobah sama sakali, manehna tetep ngabutuhkeun adaptasi anu sarua sapertos samemehna. Sairing waktu, pas populasi nu anyar mulai ngabiasakeun ka lingkungan nu anyar, maranehna mulai katingali bakal terus ngurangan siga populasi nu sejenna. Akhirna, saatos rebuan bahkan jutaan taun, 2 populasi bakal katingali benten pisan janten teu tiasa di sebat spesies anu sami. Ieu proses teh urang sebut spésiasi nu hartosna formasi spesies anyar. Spésiasi mangrupikeun akibat nu teu tiasa dihindari sareng bagian nu paling penting dina évolusi.
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small population) is separated from the main population (by moving to the other side of a mountain or a river, or by moving to a new island so that it is not easy to return) they will often encounter different resources and different enemies. The new population will need different adaptations or features to compete with the old population's enemies. The original population will not change at all, it will still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to the new environment, they will begin to look less and less like the original population. After thousands or millions of years, two populations will look very different, and cannot be called the same species. This process is called speciation, which means the formation of a new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Nalika sakelompok sakedik mahluk hirup (penduduk leutik) kapisahkeun ti populasi utami ti asal aranjeuna (sapertos pindah ka peuntas gunung atanapi walungan, atanapi upami pindah ka hiji pulo anyar supados henteu gampang balik) aranjeunna bakal sering mendakan diri di lingkunganana bénten ti sateuacan. lingkungan enggal ieu ngagaduhan bahan baku anu beda sareng musuh anu beda, janten populasi anu enggal ngabutuhkeun fitur anu beda atanapi nyesuaikeun kanggo janten saingan anu kuat ti batan anu heubeul Populasi aslina moal ngarobah sama sakali, manehna tetep ngabutuhkeun adaptasi anu sarua sapertos samemehna. The original population will not change at all, it will still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to the new environment, they will begin to look less and less like the original population. After thousands or millions of years, two populations will look very different, and cannot be called the same species. This process is called speciation, which means the formation of a new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and an important part of evolution.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Organ utama ti sistem aliran getih nyaéta jantung, anu pompa getih. Getih ngalir ti jantung ngalewatan pembuluh darah anu disebut arteri jeung balik deui ka jantung ngalewatan pembuluh darah anu disebut vena. Pembuluh darah pangleutikna disebut pembuluh kapiler.
mt: The main organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood flows from the heart through arteries and back to the heart through veins. The smallest blood vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Serangga nyaéta sato mimiti anu ngapung. Kamampuhan pikeun ngapung ngabantu maranéhna ngajauhkeun musuh  jeung néangan dahareun leuwih gampang, jeung leuwih episien mun ngéwé. Kaseueuran serangga téh ngagaduhan kaunggulan tiasa ngalipkeun jangjangna deui sapanjang awak. Ieu teh masihan maranehanana tempat-tempat kanggo nyumput ti predator. Ayeuna, hiji-hijina serangga anu teu tiasa ngalipetkeun jangjangna téh nyaéta papatong sareng laleur papatong.
mt: Insects are the first animals to evolve the ability to fly. The ability to fly helps them avoid predators and find food more easily, and more efficiently if they are large. The insect exoskeleton is also strong enough to support the weight of the body. Only four-winged insects can fly.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Seueur palayan paleontologi jaman ayeuna percaya yen 1 golongan dinosaurus tetep salamat sareng sareng hirup keneh nepi ka ayeuna. Urang nyebatna manuk. Seueur jalma anu henteu nganggapan manuk salaku dinosaurus kusabab gaduh bulu sareng tiasa hiber. nanging aya seueur perkawis ngeunaan manuk anu katembong keneh sepertos dinosaurus. Suku maranéhana boga sisit sarta koét, maranehanana ngendog, sarta maranehna mapan kawan dua suku tukang sapertos T-Rex.
mt: Many modern paleontologists believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and continued to live until today. We call them birds. Many people do not consider birds as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can hibernate. But there are some aspects of birds that look like dinosaurs. They have beaks and claws, they lay eggs, and they live in pairs like the T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Huntu triceratops lain tiasa ngahancurkeun dangdaunan hungkul tapi akar anu teuas oge tiasa. Sababaraha élmuwan nganggap Triceratops ngadahar siklik, anu mangrupikeun jenis pépélakan anu umum di jaman Cretaceous. Tatawuhan ieu katingali siga tangkal palem leutik nu boga mahkota daun nu runcing jeung seukeut. Triceratops bisa maké cucukna anu kuat keur nyoekeun daun-daun saacan ngadahar batangna. Elmuwan sanesna nyebatkeun yen pepelakan ieu teh bahaya sahingga teu mungkin pikeun tuangeunana dinosaurus, sanaos ayeuna kungkang sareng sato sanes sapertos parili (turunan dinosaurus) tiasa tuang daun anu bahaya atanapi buah.
mt: Triceratops  teeth could not only crush leaves, but also tough roots. Some scientists believe  Triceratops  ate cyclically, a common type of plant eating in the Cretaceous. This plant looks like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp and pointed leaves.  Triceratops  could use its strong beak to crush leaves before eating the stems. Other scientists have suggested that this plant was poisonous and therefore not possible for dinosaurs to eat, although today birds and other animals can eat poisonous plants or fruit.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Timnas méngbal Itali, sareng timnas méngbalJerman téh dua timnas anu paling sukses di dunya jeung mangrupikeun juara Piala Dunia FIFA di taun 2006. Olahraga anu terkenal nyaéta méngbal, basket, bola voli, polo cai, anggar, rugbi, balap sapeda, hoki es, hoki roller, sareng balap mobil F1. Olahraga usum tiis mangrupikeun anu pang kasohorna di daérah kalér, sareng Italia ngilu dina pertandingan internasional jeung acara Olimpiade.
mt: Italy, along with Germany, are two of the most successful national teams in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey, and Formula One. Winter sports are the most popular in the north, and Italy is a major player in international competition and the Olympics.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luxembourg gaduh sajarah panjang tapi tanggal kamerdekaan na ti 1839. Bagian Bélgia ayeuna mangrupikeun bagian ti Luksemburg di jaman baheula, tapi janten Bélgia saenggeus Révolusi Bélgia taun 1830. Luksemburg parantos teterusan nyobian janten nagara anu teu mihak ka sasaha nanging tetep dijajah dina Perang Dunya I sareng Perang Dunya II ku Jérman. Di 1957, Luxembourg janten anggota anu mendakan organisasi anu ayeuna mah dikenalna Uni Éropa.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence day is in 1839.  Part of Belgium in the past, it became Belgium after the Belgian Revolution in 1830.  Luxembourg continued to try to become an independent nation but was still occupied in World War I and World War II by Germany.  In 1957, Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization that is now known as the European Union.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Turki Eropa (bagian Wétan Thrace atanapi Rumelia di Balkan Peninsula) téh 3% ti sakabéh nagara. Wilayah Turki leuwih ti 1,600 kilométer (1,000 mil) panjangna sareng 800 km (500 mil) lébarna, anu bentukna kirang langkung segi opat. Daerah di Turki, situ teh nyandak 783,562 kilometer pasagi (300,948 mil pasagi) dimana eta teh 755,688 kilometer pasagi (291,773 mil pasagi) aya di bagean kidul kulon Asia jeung  23,764 kilometer pasagi (9,174 mil pasagi) di bagean Eropa. Turki ngajadikeun nagarana paling gedé anu ka-37 di dunya, sareng ukuranna satara Metropolitan Perancis sareng gabungan Inggris. Turki dikurilingan ku laut tina tilu sisi: Laut Aegea di kulon, Laut Hideung di kalér jeung Laut Mediterania di kidul.
mt: Europe (Eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan Peninsula) is 3% of the entire country. The area of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometers (1,000 miles) long and 800 km (500 miles) wide, which is roughly square. Areas in Turkey, the area is 783,562 km² (300,948 sq mi), where 755,688 km² (291,773 sq mi) is in southwestern Asia and 23,764 km² (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey is the largest country in the world, and the size of the French metropolitan area and the combined British. Turkey is surrounded by sea from three sides: the Aegean Sea in the west, the Black Sea in the north and the Mediterranean Sea in the south.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Populasi Vatican City nyaeta kira-kira 800 nyawa. Vatican nagara merdeka pangleutikna di dunya jeung nagara jeung populasi paling saeutik. Kota Vatikan ngagunakeun basa italia dina panerapan jeung komunikasi resmi. Basa Italia ogé mangrupikan basa sapopoé anu dianggo ku seueur jalmi nu damel di nagara eta sedengkeun Latin mah seringna dianggo keur upacara agama. Sadaya warga Kota Vatican nyaéta panganut Katolik Roma.
mt: The population of Vatican City is about 800 people. Vatican is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the smallest population. Vatican uses Italian in its official language and communication. Italian is also the language of the majority of the people who live in the country, while Latin is often used for religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Komputer ayeuna dipaké kanggo ngamalsukeun gambar sareng pidéo. Animasi anu canggih tiasa didamel dina komputer, sareng animasi samodél kieu langkung seueur dianggo di tipi sareng pilem. Musik sering dirékam nganggo komputer canggih pikeun ngolah sareng nyampurkeun soanten babarengan.
mt: Computers are now used to analyze images and video. Sophisticated animations can be created on computers, and sophisticated animations are increasingly used in film. Music is often recorded using advanced computers to process and mix together elements.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Kota Harappa sareng Mohenjo-daro gaduh toilet siram di ampir unggal bumi, anu disambungkeun kana sistem pembuangan limbah anu canggih. Sésa sistem limbah parantos kapeundak di pamudukan di kota Minoa di Crete sareng Santorini di Yunani. Toilet kapendak di peradaban Mesir kuno, Persia jeung Cina. Di Peradaban Romawi, toilet sakapeung ngarupakeun bagéan ti pamandian umum di mana lalaki jeung awéwé ditempatkeun ditempat anu sarua.
mt: Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had flush toilets on almost every street, connected to sophisticated sewage systems. The sewage system was later adopted in the Minoan city of Crete and Santorini in Greece. The sewage system was adopted in the ancient Egyptian, Persian and Chinese civilizations. In the Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public baths where men and women were placed in the same place.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Bilah dina sapatu skét és gaduh dua ujung anu sami-sami cekung. dua ujung éta téh tiasa leuwih saé dina nahan és, bahkan lamun keur dimiringkeun ogé. Kusabab bagéan handap bilahna rada béngkok, pas bilah doyong ka hiji sisi atawa sisi nu séjénna, tungtungna anu paadek sareng és ogé béngkok. Ieu nyieun pamaén skét és pikeun méngkol. Lamun skét miring ka tuhu, skét méngkol ka tuhu, lamun miring ka kénca, skét méngkol ka kénca.
mt: The blade of a skate has two symmetrical concave ends. Both ends can be more effective in turning, even when turning upside down. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, when the blade is turned to one side or the other, the tip and the blade also curve. This makes the skater turn. When the skate is turned to the right, the skate turns to the right, when turned to the left, the skate turns to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

Lamun skét miring ka tuhu, skét méngkol ka tuhu, lamun miring ka kénca, skét méngkol ka kénca.
mt: The blade of a skate has two symmetrical concave ends. Both ends can be more effective in turning, even when turning upside down. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, when the blade is turned to one side or the other, the tip and the blade also curve. This makes the skater turn. When the skate is turned to the right, the skate turns to the right, when turned to the left, the skate turns to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: "Pikeun ngabalikeun level energi kanu saacana, maranéhna kudu miceun kaleuwihan energi anu ditambahan ku cahaya. Atom-atom éta ngalakukeun ieu ku mancarkeun partikel cahya alit pisan anu disebat ""foton"". loba elmuan nyebut ieu proses teh ""stimulus emisi tina radiasi"" kusabab si atom teh ka pancing ku lampu anu caang, nyebabkeun emisi photon tina cahaya jeung cahaya teh salah sahiji na radiasi. Gambar saatos ieu némbongkeun bahwa atom mancarkeun foton. Dina kanyataana foton langkung alit tibatan éta dina gambar. Foton malah langkung alit tibatan anu ngabentuk atom!"
mt: "To restore the energy level that existed before, they must remove the excess energy added by the light. These atoms do this by emitting small particles of light called "photons". Many scientists call this process the "stimulated emission of radiation" because the atom is stimulated by the light, causing the emission of photons of light and light is one of the radiations. This picture shows that the atom emits a photon. In reality, the photon is smaller than that in the picture. The photon is even smaller than the atom!"
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Saatos ratusan jam hurung, éta filamén dina bohlam tungtungna kaduruk sareng bohlam henteu deui berfungsi. Lampuna teras kedah diganti. Penting kedah ati-ati lamun ngaganti lampu. Kahiji, sakelar lampu kudu dipaehan atawa kabel kudu dilepas. ieu teh kusabab listrik na ngalir kana soket anu dina eta soket teh aya bahan metal nu aya dina lampu bohlam nu matak bisa nyetrum anjeun lamun nyabak eta jero soket atawa dasar bohlam nalika dijero soket keneh.
mt: After hundreds of years, this film at the end of the reel is broken and the bulb no longer works. The bulb must be replaced. Be careful when replacing the bulb. First, the light switch must be turned off or the cable must be disconnected. This is because electricity is flowing into the socket where there is a metal material in the bulb that can shock you if you touch the inside of the socket or the base of the bulb when it is in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Bom fisi tiasa dianggo dumasar kana prinsip yén butuh énergi pikeun nyatukeun inti anu seueur proton sareng neutron. Sapertos nyurungkeun hiji karanjang beurat ka luhur bukit. Ngamisahkeun intina deui teras ngaluarkeun sababaraha énergi éta. Sababaraha atom ngabogaan inti anu henteu stabil anu hartina yen maranehanana gaduh kacondongan beulah kalawan sakedik atanapi tanpa dorongan.
mt: Nuclear fission can be used based on the principle that it takes energy to separate a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. As pushing a heavy cart up a hill. Separating the nucleus again releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei meaning that they have a tendency to go in one direction or another without any prompting.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Lamun anjeun ngahubungi jalma nu jauh pisan, anjeun teh nganggo satelit. Satelit anu di luar angkasa teh narima telepon tuluy malikeun deui eta telepon kahandap gancang pisan. Satelit éta dikirim ka luar angkasa ku rokét. Élmuwan nganggo téléskop di ruang angkasa kusabab atmosfir Bumi ngarobih sabagian cahya sareng pandangan urang. Butuh rokét raksasa langkung tina 100 kaki pikeun disimpen dina satelit atanapi teleskop di luar angkasa.
mt: If you call someone far away, you are using a satellite. A satellite in space receives a phone call and quickly relays it back to Earth. That satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere blocks some light and our view. It takes a giant rocket more than 100 feet to store a satellite or telescope in space.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Waktos mangrupikeun hal anu aya di sakuriling urang sadayana, sareng mangaruhan sagala anu urang pigawé, nanging sesah kanggo dipahaman. Waktos parantos diulik ku pamimpin agama, filsuf, jeung ilmuwan salami rébuan taun. Urang ngalaman waktos salaku rangkean kajadian anu tiheula ti masa kahareup ngalewatan jaman ayeuna dugi ka jaman baheula. Waktos ogé mangrupikeun cara urang ngabandingkeun durasi (lilana) kajadian. Anjeun tiasa nyirian waktu sorangan ku nitetan pengulangan kajadian siklus. Kajadian siklus nyaeta hiji hal anu lumangsung berulang-deui sacara teratur.

Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Sacara tradisional, panerus tahta bakal langsung asup kana militér saatos lulus sakola. Nanging, Charles kuliah di Trinity College di Universitas Cambridge. Manéhna diajar Antropologi jeung Arkéologi, tur Sajarah, jeung meunangkeun predikat 2:2 (gelar kelas kadua handap). Charles mangrupikeun anggota kahiji ti kulawarga British Royal anu ngagaduhan gelar.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would immediately enter the military after school. However, Charles studied at Trinity College at the University of Cambridge. He studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and History, and received a 2:2 (second class lower) degree. Charles is the first member of the British Royal family to have a degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Inggris téh parantos ngalaman perdamaian anu panjang saatos naklukeun deui Danelaw. Tapi dina taun 991 Ethelred berhadapan sareng armada Viking anu langkung ageung tibatan armada Guthrum sa abad ka pengker. Armada ieu dipimpin ku Olaf Trygvasson, warga nagara Norwégia anu boga ambisi nyandak balik nagarana tina jajahan Dénmark. Saeunggeus mundur militer, Ethelred akhirna satuju kanggo damai jeung Olaf anu akhirna balik deui ka Norwegia kanggo ngabangun karajaanna jeung rupa-rupa kasuksesan.
mt: England had just experienced a long period of peace after conquering the Danelaw. But in 991 Ethelred faced a larger Viking army than Guthrum's army of the previous century. This army was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian who had ambitions to retake his country from Danish rule. The English army retreated, and Ethelred eventually agreed to peace with Olaf, who then returned to Norway to build his kingdom and various successes.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: "Sakira abad ka-15, Estonia kaler aya di handap pangaruh budaya Jerman. Sababaraha biksu Jérman hoyong nyaketkeun pribumi jeung Gusti, janten aranjeunna mendakan bahasa literal Éstonia. Éta téh dumasar karna huruf German sareng 1 karakter ""Õ/õ"" ditambihkeun. Sakumaha waktos lumaku, seueur kecap anu diinjeum tina basa Jérman digabungkeun. Ieu mangrupikeun awal pancerahan."
mt: "Around the 15th century, Estonia was under the influence of German culture. Some German monks mixed with the locals and God, so they created the Estonian language. This is based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German were combined. This is the beginning of the language."
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Aya babaraha hiji perkiraan tina sababaraha jalmi anu nyarios basa India. Basa India diperkirakeun basa kadua nepi ka opat anu pangseueurna dianggo di dunya. Jumlah panyatur pribumi bervariasi gumantung kana dialek anu erat patalianana diitung atawa henteu. Diperkirakeun antara 340 juta dugi 500 juta panyatur jeung sakitar 800 juta jalma tiasa ngartos basa éta. Basa India sareng Urdu gaduh kamiripan dina kosakatana, tapi béda dina tulisanana; dina paguneman sapopoé, panyatur kadua basa biasana tiasa silih ngartos.
mt: There are several estimates of the number of native speakers of Hindi. Hindi is estimated to be the third most spoken language in the world, after Mandarin Chinese and English. The number of native speakers is difficult to estimate because of the many dialects and the inclusion or exclusion of Awadhi, Bhojpuri, and other related languages. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million native speakers and about 800 million total speakers. Hindi and Urdu have similar grammar and vocabulary, but their writing systems are different; in everyday speech, the two languages are often mutually intelligible.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: "Hangeul teh hiji-hiji na alfabet anu ngahaja diciptakeun dina huruf anu biasa dipake sapopoe, Alfabet teh diciptakeun dina taun 1444 nalika Raja Sejong  (1418 – 1450) jumeneng. Raja Séjong mangrupikeun raja ka opat ti DInasti Joeseon sareng mangrupikeun 1 raja ti raja-raja anu paling terhormat. Anjeunna aslina nganamian aksara Hangeul Hunmin Jeongeum, nu artina ""sora nu leres kanggo ngarahkeun jalmi""."
mt: "Hangeul is a phonetic alphabet that was created using common characters. The alphabet was created in 1444 when King Sejong  (1418 – 1450) reigned. King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and was one of the most respected kings. He originally named the alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""clear sounds for the people."""
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Loba teori perkara kumaha basa sansakerta muncul. salah sahijina nyaeta ngeunaan  Aryan anu migrasi ti kulon india anu mawa basa anjeunna. Basa Sansakerta nyaeta basa kuno sareng tiasa dibandingkeun sareng basa Latin anu  diucapkeun di Eropa. Buku anu pangmimitina nu dikenal di dunya ditulis dina bahasa Sanskerta. saatos pangumpulan Upanishads, bahasa Sanskerta ujug-ujug punah kusabab hirarki. Basa Sansekerta nyaéta basa anu rumit pisan jeung loba rupina. Basa ieu geus janten sumber loba basa India moderen, sapertos basa Latin nu janten sumber basa-basa Éropa sapertos Prancis sareng Spanyol.
mt: Many theories exist as to how Sanskrit came to be. One is that the Aryans migrated from western India and brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and can be compared to Latin in Europe. The oldest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the collection of the Upanishads, Sanskrit fell out of use because of its hierarchical nature. Sanskrit is a very complex language with many forms. It is the source of many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the source of many European languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Kumaha gravitasi Io bakal narik kuring? Upami anjeun nangtung dina permukaanna Io, beurat anjeun bakal kirang ti pas anjeun aya di Bumi. Jalma anu beuratna 200 pon (90kg) di Bumi beuratna sakitar 36 pon (16kg) di Io. Janten gravitasi, tangtosna, kirang narik anjeun.
mt: How will Io's gravity pull me? If I stood on Io's surface, my weight would be less than it is on Earth. A person weighing 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth weighs about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So gravity, in fact, pulls me less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Beungeut bulan di wangun ku babatuan jeung debu. Lapis pangluarna Bulan disebutna kulit. Kandel kerakna kira-kira 70 km di sisi caket sarta kandel 100 km di sisi tebih. eta leuwih ipis di sisi anu poek sareng langkung kandel di sisi anu caang Manawi aya langkung seueur maria di sisi caket margi kusabab leuwih ipis. Éta langkung gampil kanggo lava naik ka permukaan.
mt: The Moon's surface is covered in craters and dust. The outermost layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is thought to be about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner on the near side because it is more heavily cratered and thus easier for lava to rise to the surface.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: "Seueur jalma ngimpikeun poé dimana manusa tiasa ngarambat ka bintang anu sanés sareng ngajalajah alam sanés, sababaraha urang héran naon nu aya di luar ditu sareng aya sababaraha anu percaya yén mahluk luar angkasa atanapi kahirupan sanés hirup dina tutuwuhan anu sanés. Nanging, lamun ieu perkawis lumangsung manawi sigana moal kajadian kanggo wanci anu lami. Béntang-béntang nyebar pisan nepi ka aya jarak triliunan mil di antawis béntang-béntang anu ""tatanggaan"". Mungkin hiji waktos, cucu buyut aranjeun bakal nangtung di luhur dunya anu asing teras tatanya tentang leluhur kuno aranjeunna?"
mt: "Many people have wondered what it would be like to jump to another star and explore the universe, some believe that extraterrestrial life or life other than the earth lives in other plants. But if this happens when it is really happening for a long time. Stars are scattered so far that there is a distance of trillions of miles between the stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe someday, your great-grandchildren will stand above the strange world and tell you about your ancestors?"
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: "Panon poé heunteu boga kerak tempat nincak sapertos Bumi. Panon poé dijieun tina gas, seuneu, jeung plasma sakabéhna. Gasna langkung janten ipis nalika anjeun ngalih ti tengah panonpoé. Bagian pangluarna anu ku urang tingali pas ningal panon poe disebut potosfer, anu hartina ""bola cahaya""."
mt: "The sun is not a solid place like Earth. The sun is made of gas, plasma, and plasma. The gas is less dense when you move away from the center of the sun. The outermost part of the sun that we see when we look at the sun is called the photosphere, which means ""light ball."""
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: sakitar tilu rébu taun saatosna, di taun 1610, ahli astronom Italia Galileo Galilei nganggo téléskop pikeun nyimpulkeun yén Venus oge aya pase na, sapertos bulan. Fase teh aya kumargi ngan hiji bagean planet venus (atawa bulan) nu ngahareupan panon poe kacaangan. Fase planet venus ngadukung teori ti Copernicus nyaeta planet-planet teh ngulilingan panon poe. Teras, babaraha taun saatosna di taun 1639, ahli astronomi Inggris anu namina Jeremiah Horrocks niténan transit di Venus.
mt: Around three hundred years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to discover that Venus also had phases, just like the moon. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets revolved around the sun. Then, a few years later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Walungan Amazon mangrupikeun walungan kadua pangpanjangna sareng anu panggedéna di dunya. Boga cai leuwih ti 8 kali leuwih cai tibatan walungan kadua anu panggedéna. Amazon walungan panglegana di Bumi, kalayan lebar 6 mil. 20 persen cai anu nyebar di walungan-walungan nu aya di dunya teras ka laut téh asalna ti Amazon. Walungan utamina Amazon ngabogaan paos 6,387 km (3,980 mil). Walungan éta nampung cai ti rébuan anak walungan.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest and largest river in the world. It has more water than 8 times the water of the second largest river. Amazon is the longest river on Earth, with a width of 6 miles. 20 percent of the water that spreads in the rivers of the world comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River has a length of 6,387 km (3,980 miles). The river carries water from thousands of tributaries.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Dina sakumna nu aya di Venezuela, 18% jalma teu didamel, jeung kaseueuran jalma anu gaduh damel didamel dina ekonomi informal. Dua per tilu penduduk Venezuela daramel di bidang jasa, ampir saparapatna damel di bidang industri sareung saperlimana di bidang katanian. Industri anu penting kanggo wargi Venezuela nyaéta minyak, dimana nagarana janten pangékspor bersih, sanaos ngan hiji persén anu damel dina industri minyak.
mt: 18% of the population is unemployed, and two-thirds of the workforce is employed in the informal economy. Two-thirds of Venezuelans are employed in the service sector, about one-third in industry, and one-fifth in agriculture. The most important industry for Venezuelans is oil, making the country the world's largest exporter of petroleum, although only one percent of the workforce is employed in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Bentang mancarkeun cahaya sareng panas kusabab énergi anu dihasilkeun nalika atom hidrogen ngagabung (atanapi ngahiji) babarengan pikeun ngabentuk elemen anu leuwih beurat. Para élmuwan nuju didamel kanggo midamel réaktor anu tiasa ngahasilkeun energi ku cara anu sami. Nanging, ieu, mangrupikeun masalah anu sesah pisan kanggo di réngsékeun bakal mangtaun-taun saacan urang ningali reaktor fusi anu gunana di wangun.
mt: The announcement of the fusion of hydrogen atoms to form heavier elements is accompanied by the release of light and heat. Scientists are working to build a reactor that can produce energy in the same way. However, this is a very difficult problem to solve for many years before we see a fusion reactor built.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Unsur jeung sanyawa tiasa di robah ti 1 wujud ka wujud nu lain tapi tetep sarua. Nitrogén minangka gas ngabogaan kénéh sipat anu sami kalawan nitrogén éncér. Nitrogén anu éncér langkung mundel nanging molekulna sami kénéh. Conto lainna nyaéta cai. Senyawa cai téh kabentuk tina dua atom hidrogén sareng hiji atom oksigén. Ieu gaduh struktur molékul nu sami anu tiasa waé ieu téh antara gas, cairan, atanapi padet. Sanajan kaayaan fisik na tiasa robah, kaayaan kimia na mah bakal tetep.
mt: Substances can be transformed from one state to another without changing their identity. Nitrogen gas has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. It is just less dense. Other examples are water. Water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state can change, its chemical state remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Nalika Perang Revolusi, tilu welas nagara bagian ngawangun pamarentahan pusat munggaran anu lemah -kalayan Kongres mangrupikeun hiji-hijina komponen-dina Artikel Konfederasi. Kongres henteu ngagaduhan kakuatan pikeun maksa pajak, sareng kusabab henteu aya eksekutip nasional atanapi yudikatif, eta gumantung ka otoritas nagara, anu sering henteu kooperatif, pikeun maksakeun sagala tindakanana. Eta ogé teu boga kakuasaan keur kaluar ti aturan pajak jeung biaya antar nagara bagian. Pasal-pasal éta meryogikeun panyatujuan anu mutlak ti sakumna nagara bagian saacan tiasa digentos teras nagara bagian osok nganggap énteng pamaréntah pusat janten wawakilna sering teu hadir.
mt: During the Revolutionary War, thirteen states formed a weak central government—the Articles of Confederation. Congress had no power to enforce taxes, and because there was no national executive or judiciary, it depended on the states, which were often uncooperative, to take all necessary actions. It also lacked the power to change tax and trade laws between states. These provisions were intended to be temporary until all states could agree on a stronger central government.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: "Upami anjeun parantos nonton pilem National Treasure, anjeun panginten bakal mikir yén aya peta harta karun dina tukangeun Deklarasi Kamerdékaan. Nangning, eta henteu leres. Sanaos aya serat dina bagean tukang dokumen, eta sanes peta harta. Dina bagean tukang Deklarasi Kamerdekaan  aya tulisan ""Deklarasi Kamerdekaan Asli tanggal 4 Juli 1776"". Teks nembongan dina handapeun dokumen, tibalik. Sanaos teu aya 1 oge anu terang tangtos saha anu nyerat na, dipikanyaho yen dina mimiti kahirupanana, dokumen perkamen ageung (ukuranana 29¾ inci kali 24½ inci) atos digulung kanggo ditunda. Jadi, sigana notasi éta téh ditambihkeun ngan salaku labél hungkul."
mt: "If you've seen the movie National Treasure, you'll remember that the Declaration of Independence has a map to the treasure hidden in its folds. Well, it doesn't. There is writing on the back of the document, but no map. The Declaration of Independence does have a note on it, but it's not a map. The note reads "Original Declaration of Independence dated July 4, 1776." The note is on the back of the document, not on the front. And while no one knows who wrote it, it is known that in its early life, the parchment document (29¾ by 24½ inches) was rolled up and stored. So the note is just a label."
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Dina mimiti kamerdékaan negara na, ahli Kebon Botani Singapura tos ngabantu ngarubah pulo nepi ka dayeuh kebon tropis. Dina taun 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, anggrek hibrida, dipilih salaku kembang nasional nagara.
mt: In its early years of independence, Singapore's Botanic Gardens helped transform the island into a tropical city. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, a hybrid orchid, was chosen as the national flower of the country.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Dina mimiti kamerdékaan negara na, ahli Kebon Botani Singapura tos ngabantu ngarubah pulo nepi ka dayeuh kebon tropis. Dina taun 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, anggrek hibrida, dipilih salaku kembang nasional nagara.
mt: In its early years of independence, Singapore's Botanic Gardens helped transform the island into a tropical city. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, a hybrid orchid, was chosen as the national flower of the country.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Sanaos pangwangunan piramida di luhur batu diteraskeun dugi ka akhir Karajaan Lami, piramida Giza henteu pernah tiasa ngaleuwihan ukuran sareng kaunggulan téknis dina pangwangunanana. Karajaan anyar urang Mesir kuno takjub kana monumén paninggalan karuhunna, anu umurna langkung ti sarebu taun.
mt: While construction of the pyramids on top of the stone was completed by the end of the Old Kingdom, the Great Pyramid of Giza was never surpassed in size or technical prowess in construction. The new Egyptian kings were amazed by the monuments left by their ancestors, which were over 4,500 years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Unggal taun sakitar sasih Oktober ampir 1,5 juta sasatoan hérbivorangumbara nuju ka dataran belah kidul, meuntas Walungan Mara, ti bukit belah kalér pikeun ngarasakeun hujan. Teras balik deui ka kalér ngaliwateun kulon, nyebrangan deui walungan Mara, saatos usum ngijih sakitar April. Di wewengkon Serengeti aya Taman Nasional Serengeti, Area Konservasi Ngorongoro, sareng Cagar Alam Maswa di Tanzania sareng Cagar Alam Nasional Maasai Mara National di Kenya.
mt: 1.5 million herbivores migrate southwards across the Mara River from the northern hills to the plains in October, returning northwards in April after the rainy season. The Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro Conservation Area, and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya are the main areas affected.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: "Saatos pertempuran sareng Prancis réngsé, Jérman teras siap-siap pikeun nyerang pulo Inggris. Jérman nganamian kode serangan éta ""Operasi Singa Laut"". Seuseueurna pakarang beurat sareng bebekelan Angkatan Darat Inggris leungit pas diungsikeun ti Dunkrik, jadi pasukanna keur rada lemah. Tapi Angkatan Laut Kerajaan masih kénéh leuwih kuat tibatan Angkatan Laut Jerman (“Kriegsmarine”) sareng tiasa waé ngancurkeun armada invasi naon wae anu dikirim lewat Selat Inggris. Nanging, ngan sakedik pisan Angkatan Laut Karajaan anu pangkalanna caket rute pertempuran kusabab para laksamana sieun dititeuleumkeun ku serangan kapal udara Jérman."
mt: "After the battle with France ended, Germany was ready to attack the island of Britain. Germany had named the invasion code "Operation Sea Lion". The British Army was weakened and demoralized after being evacuated from Dunkirk, so their forces were relatively weak. But the Royal Navy was still stronger than the German Navy ("Kriegsmarine") and could easily destroy any invasion fleet that was sent through the English Channel. But only a few of the Royal Navy were in the battle zone because the admirals were being called away by German air attacks."
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.
